review_body: While I realize most people buy these collars for a dog or cat, we bought them for our goats! The collars have stood up very well, even when faced with some curious goat nibbles. They are showing a little dirt, but after 5 months in a goat pen, I think they still look pretty great. I'm back to order the 1" size as the girls have grown large enough. For the record, Harriet (Tubman) is wearing the blue collar and Ruth (Bader Ginsburg) is sporting the pink one!

Love love love this collar!!! I got the purple one and it's so adorable on my Pitbull's solid grey coat. I got a size mediuim for her and she weighs almost 40lbs. It's thick and durable just as I was needing. Will be purchasing from this buyer again!

review_title: ***update *** material is slippery and it keeps loosening
review_body: Nice but the material is slippery and it keeps loosening.  I have the check it every couple of days and re adjust.*** update ***** 3 months after I purchased this product it has started to unravel.  I still need to tighten this every other day and the company responded to my previous comments saying that I installed it incorrectly,  but could not show me a proper installation.

review_title: Neon Green Blueberry Collar is a winner
review_body: I really love this collar.  The color is great and the quality is there.  I purchased this for my AB puppy who has a 14" neck and the medium fits greats with room to grow.

Got this in the royal blue (Dodger blue for my fellow fans ;-) ) for my golden retriever puppy when he outgrew his cat sized collar.  I bought the medium and tightened it all the way when he was smaller (~20-25bs) and it fit well.  Fast forward to today, hes 55lbs and it's been loosened about half way and still has room for him to grow.  It's held up very well between him always getting wet (if there's water to play in, he finds it), rough housing at the dog park, and recently the beach; it hasn't faded and the color hasn't bled.  I wouldn't hesitate to buy again and would highly recommend this collar.

I love the quality of Blueberry pet products and these are no exception. I have a 70 lb German Shepherd puppy and they fit him well and are durable. Even though he chews on them after a bath sometimes, they show no signs of wear.

We have been using this collar for various rescue dogs that have found their ways to our house over the past year instead of a regular collar, but it's gotten plenty of use because most of these dogs have had no leash manners at all and will pull and pull and pull on walks.

review_title: Unique Color Selection, High Quality, Great Price!
review_body: Super solid collar. Absolutely love the color and that it's not like every other collar or leash sold in mainstream pet stores. I use it on our black wire haired dachshund mix so it pops even more, and she gets complimented all the time! It's held up great, even through doggy daycare visits which has proven to be rough on these. We bought the matching leash as well. This was my first time purchasing this brand but I definitely recommend both this product as well as the brand!
Make sure to measure and purchase according to sizing as listed.  Very cute and decent material,  it looks great on my kitten!

review_title: Super cute! I love the simple colors and it ...
review_body: Super cute! I love the simple colors and it seems to made of good quality material (no issues attached to a leash or anything). I have been adjusting it as my puppy grows and I love how it looks.

This is our fluffy brat baby named Finn. Finn is a miniature American Eskimo. He was in a ridiculous low quality petsmart collar that was a size medium when we first adopted him at 5 months old (he is a little over 6 months now). It didn't fit at all. I'm not sure why he was in a collar that size. Anyway these Blueberry (I was pleasantly surprised they don't only come in the color blue) collars looked nice so my fiancé and I were like, why not, let's buy our dog a collar that isn't crap because we love our fluffy brat baby dog and want him in a collar that fits him. After engaging in a brief dispute about collar colors because my boyfriend still sometimes tries to push gender roles onto our two male dogs (it's 2017, wake up babe), we settled on the color emerald in a size small. Now, we are both satisfied about the aesthetics of the collar, I'm satisfied that my boyfriend is becoming more progressive, and most importantly it is the correct size and high quality. Craving more pup antics? Follow my fur squad on instagram at dieselandfinn.atx ;)

This collar is okay. I've had it for about a year and I hesitate to give it three stars. If I were using this collar solely for the purpose of holding my dog's tags then it would serve its purpose just fine. It is cute and holds up well, though it picks up dirt and discolors easily (I own the light mint color). However, the type of material it's made from means that when used with a leash the collar will loosen quite often, even with only minor tugging. My dog doesn't yank or tug when we walk, but just from normal leash usage I have to check the collar daily to make sure that it's fit properly around her neck. Even then, my dog has still slipped out of it on a walk three times now when it was loose and I didn't realize it. Thankfully she just was distracted and stays easily by my side, but I see this as an issue when the collar loosens so frequently. This could be a safety hazard for dogs who may run into the street or who aren't trained to come right back to their owners. I don't believe I would purchase this again in the future.

review_title: Great collar but room for improvement in the XS sized design.
review_body: I bought this in the smallest size for my Havanese puppy, who was 3 lbs when he came home (now is 4-4.5 lbs). The size is perfect in terms of circumference.

I bought the "Medium Turquoise" in a size Small for my 12lb. Cockapoo and its perfect! Its not too thick on her neck and I have the length setting roughly in the middle, so theres plenty of room for her fluff to grow out or to tighten it when I cut her hair short in the summer. I plan on coming back for the matching leash! The quality feels very sturdy, and the color is beautiful. She's a blue merle cockapoo and it's hard finding blue stuff that doesn't make people assume she's a boy. I also upgraded her dog tag which I also purchased on Amazon just in case anyone was wondering :) I'll post some pics! I hope this helps!

review_title: Sturdy and a beautiful color (dark orchid)
review_body: We live near the ocean and my dog, Joey LOVES to run out into the waves. Salt water is notoriously hard on a lot of materials, but this collar seems to be strong enough to stand up to that, Joey's rolling in the sand, and his many walks on the leash. Adjusting the size of this collar is a little difficult, but I was able to make it a little bigger than it was when it arrived. The dark orchid color is bright and a beautiful jewel tone, and most of the parts (clasp, buckles, etc.) are a sturdy but flexible plastic. The only metal is the loop for the leash and/or license/ID/ rabies tags. Joey is an Aussie and about 40 pounds and I bought the medium-size - it seems to be fine. So far I'm very happy with it!

review_title: All sizes cost almost the same
review_body: Ended up being smaller than expected and too small for my foster dogs. I probably should have double checked the size chart. I feel these are a little overpriced for the smaller collars as well, and they are almost as much as the larger sizes cost. I buy most of my small dog collars for $3 or less usually. These are slightly nicer than what I buy, but a six dollar jump for a similar product is still a lot. The colors are cute though, and the variety is nice. The lavender I purchased is a pretty color. If you're looking for a more unique color, then that is mostly what you will be paying more for.  If I need a larger size, I might buy this brand again. Otherwise, I will keep buying the other brand I've been using.

I've purchased three Blueberry Pet collars in the past for our pets, so when my Grandson was getting a new pup, I immediately went to Blueberry Pet pages on Amazon to get a new collar and leash.  Pup is a lab/shepherd mix, five months old and 35 lbs; with expectation to about double in size.  We got the collar before we could measure and went with a medium based on photos of the pup (he was a rescue from another state).  It fits him perfectly and likely will up to adulthood as well.  Blueberry Pet collars tend to have a lot of adjustability in them.

Returned this as it was defective. Was pleased to get the item on time and seemingly exactly as I wanted.  But then I went to adjust the collar to the length needed.  As I did so, I found that the plastic "slider" that holds the end of the material and slides along the collar to adjust the length was broken. The black plastic is split at the bottom.  It looks like a design problem:  The slider width is too small to handle the bulk of the collar material.  That, combined with brittle plastic seems to make the piece break even without any of the lateral pressure that it would face once it was pulled flat and actually put on the dog.  For this reason I did not ask for a replacement.

review_title: I ordered the green and it's awesome. These collars are well made
review_body: I ordered this in a large for my 70 pound pit bull. I ordered the green and it's awesome. These collars are well made, and the large fit him well. I think he did have room to make the collar larger if he needs it. BUT he has a very large, thick neck and this fit him very well.  The color is hard to describe because it was so bright and brilliant. It is like a lime green. Very, very nice. After purchasing this collar for him, I actually ordered another printed collar from blueberry pet for another of my dogs. I can't say enough about how nice these collars are!

Love these collars!  We got the marine blue embroidered with black font for our gorgeous, red American Bulldog, Rusty.  He looks so dapper in his new blue collar!  Had originally considered going with leather, but these nylon collars seem hold up well to the punishment they receive.  We had bought him a weatherproof blue collar with a metal name plate.  It was adequate, but didn't last that long.  The name plate came loose and he completely dislodged it.  He's had an embroidered collar in the past and it seemed to work pretty well, so we thought we'd give this one a try.  We LOVE the wide selection of available colors.  They offer a lot of choices and not just a few basic colors.  We also feel a little more secure knowing the name plate can't be dislodged or lost this time.  We may go ahead and order for our other dogs as well.

Very nice looking.  Has a little bit of a sheen to it which makes it pretty.  I like the thickness of the material and the width of it.  I like that it clicks together.  Our last leash didn't and we almost couldn't get it off when she outgrew it!  The only thing I don't like (took off 1 star, besides the fact that we've only had it a week so far)  is that the rubber tag that says "Blueberry" on it is right in the way of where I need to tighten it to.  The rubber tag can actually feed through, but I don't want to leave it inside the buckle as it seems like it may be too thick and wear it out.  If I pull the tag all the way through it is slightly too tight.  Instead, I just cinched it right up to the tag and left it there, slightly too loose.  Slightly annoying, but I do love this collar so far!  Very classy and seems to be awesome quality.

review_title: Very durable and the color is vibrant!
review_body: I had ordered this collar for my fat cat.. we always use dog collars for him because the cat collars break apart too easy and being that he needs to be township tagged.. he needs a good collar. We always buy a small dog collar but this one was a little too big. This wasn’t the company’s fault which is why I still gave this 5 stars.. it was my fault for buying a collar online being that it’s for a cat. I had a hard time finding the shade of purple for his collar and when I found this.. I HAD to purchase it. My cat still wears this collar even though it’s a little big... there’s no choking hazard so it’s all good. The quality of this collar is awesome.. it’s so thick and durable and I love the color it’s so vibrant! He’s a brown/black tiger cat.. so you can see it really good! Would highly recommend this for a dog or any fatty cat! 😺

review_title: Keeps puppy, myself, and vehicle safer
review_body: I have a 25 lb puppy that I take everywhere with me. She always wants to sit in my lap while I drive and/or try to sit on my shoulders... I've never seen another dog try to wrap its body around one's shoulders like a scarf and as funny as it is, it's really dangerous. I paid $10 for a red Blueberry car seat strap for the dog and it works perfectly in my 2018 Honda Civic. I click it in the back seat and have it adjusted so she can reach both windows, but not the front and she still has plenty of room. I attach it to her with a padded harness for extra protection. No worrying about her jumping out of the window, being thrown out through the windshield in an accident, changing gears, or distracting me. I think it's a great product. I'll buy Blueberry again for sure, the color is really vibrant.

review_title: the clip doesn't come off easily, and I the color is nice
review_body: Only on week one but so far it seems durable, the clip doesn't come off easily, and I the color is nice; I got green and thinking of getting another color. Our dog is a white American Shepard and about 120lb and the large with the adjustable strap is perfect.

review_title: It could use another wash but it's in perfect condition.
review_body: One of my dogs has made a spectacular game of ripping this off the other and prancing around. It's be tugged at chewed on and left out in the sun and rain when she hides it well. It could use another wash but it's in perfect condition.
Nice color options and good quality. Would buy this again.

review_title: Looks stylish!  Durable and hides dirt well
review_body: I really love this Burberry 1 inch classic collar. It’s true to size, and easy to adjust the right neck size of your dog.  I ordered the Royal blue color and I think it looks classy on my dog, and has held up well despite him rolling in the mud. I bought this one because our old one was literally falling apart (a different brand), and so far it seems very durable and easy to keep clean. It feels very secure with heavy duty buckles and a sturdy D ring. The old collar would drive me nuts when it got dirty because it would show every spec of dirt on it, but that is not so with this Burberrys collar. It also seems very tough and durable, which is great when you have a stubborn 75 pound dog that likes to walk you instead of being walked. I got the large size which fits him perfectly. The Burberry tag on it is very unobtrusive if you don’t like it, but I think it looks great, you could also take a seam ripper to it if you hate it that much, but I wouldn’t bother.
I bought this collar less than one month ago. The buckle broke and my dog got away. Luckily I got him back but lesson learned...if your dog is strong don't bother with this collar.
Love this color! I paired the emerald collar with the flamingo leash and it's girly enough but not over the top - perfect. I have a ~30lb English Bully (fully grown) and the medium fit perfectly.

review_title: Great colors, druable, yes names are covered slightly...but get over it
review_body: I ordered three of these collars a while back, for 3 chihuahuas. The collar in itself is a very durable sturdy collar, that seems it will do its job well over time. The colors we choose were great and the color combination with the thread can totally make it your own. The colors are true both in collars and the thread for the stitching. It is noted heavily that the placement of the stitching is off and therefore when adjusted you cannot fully read it anymore. Well my 3 dogs all go small collars, but they all have different neck sizes (we have a thin guy, a fat guy, and a girl thats in between) so all of their adjusted sizes are different, and all have the adjustment piece covering some part of their name/number. The point being, no matter where the embroidery, when adjusted the name may be covered. So I do not think that this is something that the seller can fix unless they know your dogs true neck size and adjust it before stitching which is a crazy thing to ask for. Anyways these collars will get the job done, if your pet gets lost, the person can remove the collar to fully read the name, which is better than no name or number on your pet at all!

review_title: Measure carefully. Note position of the label - if you adjust size down too far, it will get in the way. Otherwise it's great!
review_body: Fits Welsh Terrier perfectly. If you get the regular/medium, take note that the Blueberry pet label might get in the way if you need a smaller setting. The collar "just" fits our dog. If we had to tighten it up any more, we would have to remove the label. Doable, but...

review_title: Heavy duty, bright, wish the tag were in a different place
review_body: This is a heavy-duty color with nice bright colors. I bought the light blue (medium turquoise) and the neon green to help tell almost identical puppies apart. One downside is that while the brand tag is sewn on very nicely with matching color thread for both sides, it's in the way of making the collar smaller. I cut the stitches to get the label off so I could slide the buckles along the collar to make it the smallest size.
Really, really cute! Our 8-week old golden hadn't worn a collar before, but when we tried this collar, she didn't seem to notice or even mind. I bought a matching leash and they look so cute on her!
Fits perfectly on my husky puppy! He's 4 months old and I purchased the size medium. The collar looks very sturdy and thick and it is adjustable so I can adjust it to get wider as my puppy grows!

My pup uses a 10 inch collar and this should have worked fine. But if I adjust it down to fit her neck, part of my phone number is covered up. I should have only put my phone number on there, but I included “Please Call”, because it allowed that many characters. Big mistake! Now I can’t use this collar at all because the most important info, my phone number, isn’t visible. Waste of money!

review_title: Rough, scratchy, construction, definitely not suitable for dogs with thin coats.
review_body: I hoped this collar would be a good fit for my 8lb Jack Russell x Miniature Pinscher. My dog has super thin fur and delicate skin.  I hoped specifically that it would be softer and made of higher quality material than what's available at the pet mart around the corner.

The Brilliant Blue suits my Darwin perfectly - I love it. He has gained 9 lbs since I have had him and it has held up extremely well due to the durability & adjust-ability of the collar. Now to resist the urge to buy one in every color.

review_title: Great price and so far so good! Fits fat chihuahua
review_body: We use a no pull harness for walks, but this collar is so I can make sure if she gets out she has tags on her - she has an updated chip, but both are top important to get dogs back.

This collar is very cute. The color is very accurate and matches the picture. The reason I am giving it 4 stars is that the clasp is not very strong. It is very easy to pull it apart without pressing in the sides. This is not a huge concern for me because I don't attach the leash to the collar while walking my dog (she has a harness) and I'm mainly using the collar for the dog tags. If you have a dog who likes to pull on walks and you plan on attaching the leash to the collar, I would suggest a different brand just in case the collar comes off when the dog pulls.

I got a size small for 8-week-old Labrador puppy. The size is perfect, with plenty of room to grow. The colours are bright, though I haven’t had it long enough to see if it dulls or dirties quickly. I get the impression it will stay bright and clean easily.  I haven’t put the ring to any pull test, but I’m impressed with the thickness of the ring and the stitching around it. My puppy’s ID tag, on a ring, not S-hook, slid on very easily. The clip feels sturdy; it snaps together easily and firmly. I’m not worried the clip will break.

It's pretty, but it was too big for my chihuahua and she's 8 lbs. It fit my 100lb Bull Mastiff well though. The material is slippery, like silky and it loosens often. I had to shorten it and sew it so the collar wouldn't go past the stopper. I really needed a new collar for both of my dogs so this will have to do for now. Oh yeah and this is just day one...

Fit perfectly, lovely turquoise blue color, and the label was easily removed with a seam ripper. Ultimately very unhappy with my purchase because of the location of the leash clip. It was too close to the clasp, as  you can see in the photo, and the combined weight kept it in the wrong place, the front. I was always searching for the leash clasp unlike another collar I own that didn't have the same design issue and problem. I no longer use it and it will be donated to frustrate someone else.

Quality is good but sizing posted from manufacturer is off slightly.  I just received a medium collar and the sizing chart lists length 14.5 - 20" however moving to smallest size (where adjustment buckle is against blueberry pet logo the length is closer to 13.5".  On the max length I could adjust is 19.5".

review_title: Nice collar but adjuster covers custom text.
review_body: I purchased two customized collars - one for each of my two dogs - with their names and my phone number. The collars seem to be high quality and the colors are as expected. Unfortunately, once the collar is adjusted, the adjuster lands directly in the middle of the text. It looks a bit silly but if my dogs ever got lost, I'm sure the person who finds them could figure it out. It would be better if the Blueberry tag was on the other side of the text so that this wouldn't happen.

I bought this for my akita mix when she was a leetle puppy.  Now she is a big puppy at seven months.  This collar has impressed me by not only being adorable, but keeping a pretty large and strong puppy secure on a leash without snapping off.  Even when she has lunged at birds or squirrels while she is on a leash, this collar has kept my puppy secure.  Plus it's bright and visible!

This is a very sturdy dog collar.  I selected it in Emerald Green thinking that the color pictured must be wrong because emerald is a darker rich green.  However, the color that I got is exactly as it is pictured and more of a teal.  I still like the collar and I am okay with the color.  Just don't expect emerald to be emerald

review_title: I was happy with the result and would strongly offer support for ...
review_body: I received the purple collar along with the purple leash that arrived very quickly via UPS delivery.  The collar was packed well in a card board small box inside of a clear plastic bag.  The dog collar was strong and fit the dog perfectly.  It went well with the purple dog leash and was complimentary

review_title: High quality, vivid colors, nice stitching
review_body: These are well-made collars to last a long time. The embroidery has great clarity, the collar material is solid, the fit is great (adjustable), and the colors are vivid. After ordering 2 for my dogs, they have been wearing for several weeks now, they still look and function just like new. So glad I ordered; very pleased with both collars ordered in different color combinations. And if my dogs get lost, I have more peace of mind because anyone who finds my babies will easily read the bold large print to call me. Thank you for a great product.

review_title: Love the Blueberry Pet Collars - for off label use
review_body: Love the Blueberry Pet Collars - for off label use!  I use the pet collar as my keychain.  I clip my key ring to it & then can use the collar as either a bracelet to keep my hands free - or clip the collar on the strap of my tote bag/or cooler handle, to keep my keys from falling out.  Several of my friends have begun using these collars as keychains also!

I love this collar! I got the light blue for my dogs and he looks so great it in. He's been wearing it over a year and it's still holding up fine. It does well in the washing machine too. I hang dry it though.

The collar appears sturdy, but the ridiculous placement of the advertising piece cuts off 2 inches of adjustments. My dog has a 14" neck but I could not tighten this collar to 14" because of the name tag in the way. I took the annoying label off and was able to make the collar smaller and therefore fit my dog. This is a just dog collar, there's no reason to make our pet a walking billboard.
Fit perfectly on my 7 month old golden. It doesn't cause his neck to itch ether like other cloth collars have. This collar is very well made.

review_title: Small worked well for 12 pound dog
review_body: This collar in small was perfect for my 12 pound poodle. Most collars I find in stores are too thin in a small size but don't get tight enough in a medium. The color was vivid as expected.

review_title: I still like it, and I'm hoping it will fit better ...
review_body: This is a very cute and simple dog collar. My only complaint is that, despite ordering the extra small, it is still a bit too small for my miniature schnauzer puppy's very tiny neck. It adjusts smaller, but there's a rubber label sewn onto it (shown in photo) that blocks you from tightening it all the way. I was able to shove the label into the plastic part that moves along the collar to tighten it, but now it sticks out in a strange way. I still like it, and I'm hoping it will fit better as she grows. I especially like the snap fastener feature--it's secure, but makes it easy to remove for baths and what not.
Love this collar. The Large fits my 65 lb mountain cur perfectly with room to grow and he has a thick neck. Seems like very good quality too.

I thought this was going to be pretty cheap because it’s half the price as a similar one I saw at petsmart but it’s actualy nicer than that! It’s really good quality and looks great on my dog! He usually wears a harness but we only put it on for walks. We wanted a collar to keep on him while camping and this is perfect! We got a medium and adjusted it.
Great fit! Nice collar! Color is vibrant. I have a yorkie and a morkie I purchased 2 of these to fit one is 7 lbs and the other is 8 lbs and they fit great!!
I love this so much! It's durable, we've had it for a few months now and it hasn't faded and it's still intact which is saying a lot because our dog is crazy!! And of course the color is perfect!!!

review_title: Great collar! But beware of sizing.
review_body: This is a great collar! It's high-quality and feels very study and durable. I like the quick-release clip, the D-ring for leash and tags, and the adjustable size.
It looks great on our little husky pup.ca liked it so much we already bought a larger size in the same color for when she gets too big for this one.

Liked it so well, we bought another.  Our first was black, but people thought our dog was a male.  Since it was such a good collar, we bought one that is pink.  Some people still call her a HE - people can be so dumb.  Anyway, excellent collar for the price.

This collar is well-made and just as described. I ordered purple, size medium, for our Golden Retriever and it's perfect. She's on the small side, around 50 lbs., but the collar could be adjusted to fit a larger dog. It's sturdy, the clasp holds tight, and the color is bright without any noticeable fading or bleeding even though it has gotten wet on several occasions.

I bought two, a pink and a turquoise, for my young pups. The colors are gorgeous and the collars are sturdy and well made, but there's no way they will adjust down to 18 inches. If you leave the rubber label in place, you can get the collar down to 20 1/2 inches, but no less. The label is stitched on and easily removed, not what the manufacturer had in mind, I'm sure, but without the label you can get the size down to 19 inches. At 19 inches, you run into the doubled braid and stitching that holds the clasp and ring in place, which won't fit through the buckle. My pups will grow into these collars, and they are really nice collars, they just can't adjust as small as the ad copy says.

review_title: Can't escape the quality of this collar!
review_body: Great quality with lots of color choices. I gave one as a gift and was so impressed with the quality that I bought another for my dog! I have a husky who is very stubborn and with past collars, he was able to break the clasp and get off the leash. No worries with this collar, he can tug all he wants but is unable to break free.

Medium fits our 20-25lb cocker spaniel. French pink is very vibrant. It appears to have a snug fit , wish the annoying brand tag wasn't there as it could be tightened more if that was removed.. 2 stars off for the poor placement.

After ordering one for our big dog (Labradoodle), we decided to order the same kind for our new puppy. These are very rugged and strong collars. Our doodle plays at the river and this collar has never came off nor broken like some of his other collars he has had. The fact that it comes in a WIDE variety of colors is an added bonus. I would definitely recommend this collar to ANYONE who is looking for a well made, strong product!!!

review_title: Loved the bright red color but within a couple days ...
review_body: Loved the bright red color but within a couple days of having it on, our mini dachshund broke out in dermatitis. Disappointed because the color was very rich but the collar was very scratchy and bothersome.

My only concern ordering this was if the adjuster would get in the way of the name and phone number. I measured My dogs current collar (14ich) and compared to the size chart. My dog is 30lbs so probably needed a medium. I ordered a small because the inches matched and there seemed to be room for the writing, also, I wanted it to be a bit thinner to be more comfortable. Its perfect. The clip seems a little cheep but I only attach his leash to his harness so the only purpose in this collar is in case he gets lost. Picked yellow on black so it would show up, looks good.

review_title: Great option for personalize your pets collar!!
review_body: Love this collar! I’ve actually purchased two at this point. One for my black lab and another for my brothers new puppy. I’ve only bought the light pink ones but they’re great quality for the price. Usually these types of collars elsewhere would be twice as much so I was so excited when I discovered them. Highly recommend!! One thing I do wish though is that there were more color options for the text. Otherwise this was a great overall purchase!!

This collar is super cute! I do have to say I did think it was a little thin compared to some collars I have purchased in the last, but in the way that it's not very padded, it is still very strong, especially the buckle which is important. The other thing is if you need to tighten the collar very tough, the "blueberry pet" logo is an actual rubber piece on the collar, which makes it a bit difficult to do that. But's a good collar and works well, especially for the price and looks very cute!

I have a small dog, and the placement of the text is centered on the collar, so when I adjust it to fit her part of the phone number is covered by the buckle. This would mean that if she were lost, someone would have to remove and expand the collar to figure out the number-not ideal. If the text was left centered (where the company logo is) it would be better. It's also bulkier than I was expecting; the buckle never really lays correctly and sticks out. I bought a metal ID tag that slips on her old collar and it works much better, and was less costly.

Large size was a tad too big for my pit girl, but i walk her on a harness so it’s perfectly fine for every day wear.  Should’ve gotten a medium, but that’s my fault! Make sure and measure your fur babies before purchasing. Also, there is only one Large sized hoop on the collar for the leash, no smaller sized hoops for a Dog Tag. But the collar is beautiful and great quality.

review_title: Although I do love the color and price
review_body: I ordered a small for my maltipoo and it was still too big for him. This collar is not a wide as others and I think that is why it slides so much on him. I ended up buying a collar in store because it was easier for me. If your dog has a small neck I would advise against purchasing this collar. Although I do love the color and price. Just didn't work best for us.

review_title: Nice collar. My dog is an Anatolian Shepard
review_body: Nice collar. My dog is an Anatolian Shepard, and even though he is only seven months old, he weighs more than 90 pounds. The collar is wide enough to look good on him, and there is plenty of adjustment left to allow for growth, which this dog certainly will. delivery was fast and service was excellent.
Doesn't strangle our dog, which is something I look for in a dog collar. It seems sturdy. Vibrant color.

Good collar, but don’t trust the 20” claim. It’s under 19.5” when buckled. They measured unbuckled, which includes over half an inch that inserts into the opposite end, so should not count in the total length. My Great Pyrenees finds it to be a bit too snug.

review_title: Love these collars for the safety clasp
review_body: Love these collars for the safety clasp. They hold up real well and I buy them to replace old ones when the logo fades out (my pups are rough on them). They last a long time like 2 years or so before that happens.

review_title: Great if it fits just right...
review_body: I like the collar and the colors are great, but you can't see the phone number, which is WAY more important than the name. If he gets out someone would have to loosen or take off the collar to get the phone number, which might allow him to slip away.
Easy to adjust and put on, lovely color and seems very comfortable for my pup.

review_title: Love it but had a scare!
review_body: I really like this product. It matches our harness and leash perfectly. It comes off reflective. I do wish it had an additional ring for id tags separate from where the leash attaches. Today it just fell off of him. I do not know if that was operator error or product. I swear I heard it snap but almost lost our pup in the corn fields today. Still would highly recommend this product. Giving it another chance. Had a big scare today. Even with microchip a collar with id is no good if it falls off the dog.

Very nice “stand in” collar for my dog! The color I chose - violet - is beautiful & vibrant. It has not caused any color transfer onto my fluffy white dog’s coat, & the buckle has not snagged her hair. The only reason it will not be her “full time” collar is because a softer nylon weave is recommended for soft double coat breeds like my Samoyed. A great affordable option!

review_title: I ordered the short seat belt buckle for my dachshund ...
review_body: I ordered the short seat belt buckle for my dachshund. He can still walk around the entire back seat and over to the driver's side if he's buckled in the passenger side. Thankfully he isn't very interested in moving around but he loves to stare out the window and this allows him to do so while staying buckled in. Not too convinced it would keep him safe or even in the seat in a collision, but that's because of his size and not the buckle.

Fits perfectly on my cat. I've had it for a few months now and everything is still fine. We've used it with her on a leash as well and it works. The only thing I worry about is that I don't want to make it too tight so sometimes if she pulls it's possible she could slip out of it. My cat is very calm and well behaved and so I don't have to worry about her getting away.
(I was worried that the logo would be super noticeable and tacky looking, but it blends in so well.)

Our 40-lb Australian cattle dog outgrew her old color and we wanted something strong but bright. I overshot the size (got a large, but should have gotten her a medium) but she is good at the tightest setting. Nice and sturdy, well constructed. Will probably order another one for our 80-lb mastador when the time comes for a new one.

review_title: Perfect. Good quality and beach proof!
review_body: I love this! The quality is good. The font is quite legible and exactly what I thought it would be. I added dashes to the phone number and see if they add it as well (the pictures don't have the dashes) and they did. So it's all I needed to be.

This is a cute little color and is very durable.  The green is a pretty pastel green color and looks very nice on my little white dog.  I would def order this again.  I bought a larger one for my chihuahua and it is great too although the pink is not really a bright pink and it looks rather red in different light.

Company was AMAZING!!!! I was unhappy with the product because my dog has a long skinny neck and I didn't like the stiffness of the collar I wanted it to be a little more flexible, BUT the product was beautiful it just didn't fit right, maybe on a different dog it would be better, but the company is great. I would try their products again!!
Very pigmented and looks really good on my lab Lexi. :)

It’s my own fault for believing that no one would put the company label on the OUTSIDE of the collar!  And let me tell ya, that label is on there for good!  A brain surgeon with a scalpel couldn’t get it off, nor a carpenter with a crowbar. As my dog’s name is NOT Burberry, as it reads on the collar for all to see, I’ve pitched it in the trash.  Costs six bucks to return a ten buck collar.  Not worth the trouble.

review_title: My Yorkie loves these treats and they're healthy!
review_body: My Yorkie is no longer a puppy at 4 years old but she likes very small chewy treats. She has been gaining weight because the treats I give her are larger and I thought these Wellness Soft Puppy Bites may be a good treat for her IF she liked them. She is oh so picky. This bag of treats is small but there are quite a few little square softish treats in there. They are a bit bigger than a dime (see photo) and soft. It doesn't take much to chew these. Obviously for little puppies that is ideal.

I have a 6 year old rescue toy poodle, she's missing some teeth and has a real sensitive stomach. We use these treats for her along with the crunchy bites. She loves them, and these soft ones can be easily torn into smaller bites if you are worried about calorie intake. Good ingredients, and not an outrageous price either ( dog treats are getting ridiculous for some brands as far as costs go) only drawback is the package is hard to dip your hand in without both hands and does not reseal easily. I take them out and put them in a different container.

review_title: Good soft medium value treat for pups
review_body: I bought these for my 8 week old pup and he took to them immediately. I love that their ingredients are meat and plant-based, not filled with grains. My puppy seems to love the flavor, and the scent is atttractive enough to hold his attention but not so much it’s stinky.

review_title: YOU CAN'T GO WRONG WITH THESE TREATS!
review_body: I bought these for training my new puppy. I don't know why I took them to the airport with me when I picked my up, but I was very glad I did! My little guy was scared to death & cowered in the back of the carrier. I coaxed him out with the treat. He was shaking like a leaf, so I held him and spoke to him quietly for a few minutes. A note on the carrier said he hadn't eaten anything during his only layover, so as soon as he'd stopped shaking, I offered him a treat. He gobbled it down & wound up eating almost the whole bag. I bought another bag of these (at a store what shall remain nameless), & he really does love them! So I've signed up for Subscribe & Save, & they're even cheaper buying them that way! In the photo I've provided,  I had just asked him if he wanted a treat. Note the ears up & intent look.

review_title: great for training and everyday treats
review_body: My dog loves these treats. They are the perfect size for training & reinforcement. He is a small Chi mix about 10lbs. and prefers softer side of food/treats and these are his favorite. I have subscribed to them monthly to ensure he will always have his favorite snack.

review_title: good for your canine buddy and  a helpful tool-
review_body: I am trying to train a Yorkie  to use his pee pads- - These are wonderful assist tools- he loves them- no tummy problems which was my main worry-I do break in 4ths-  - He was just neutered and a bit angry about the cone he was having to wear- these helped with  wanting to gnaw the one as well-  --I bought two flavors- and several packs- they  zip up really well and stay fresh--

review_title: Great for older Dogs with very few Teeth left.
review_body: I watch my son's and Daughter in Laws 13 year old Teacup Yorkie who weighs 3 pounds.(The runt of the litter) .The dog is Healthy and active but has very few Teeth left so with the recommendation of his Vet we started buying Wellness Soft Bites a few years ago so he is not deprived of his treats.He loves these Soft Bites and gets crazy happy whenever we pull the bag out he knows exactly what time it is.Though these are small perfect for Puppies we do break them in half due to his digestive system and because he eats them like he is in a eating competition.Love that they are grain free and feel confident knowing we are giving him the best! The bag is rather small but they do last long because we only give him a few a day as recommend.I also appreciate they are not harming what Teeth he has left.We also buy the Wellness Puppy food which he loves.I would recommend this for your Puppies and also older Dogs especially those who do not have all there Teeth anymore.Will always buy this Brand and price point is cheaper than our local Petco where we live and they get delivered right to our door. Very Convenient having prime.

review_title: I don't feel I should have to break them apart
review_body: Normally I read a few reviews before buying something on Amazon, but took the high star rating since I was in a rush.  We had mini training treats when we first brought home our puppies, but went through them quickly as we only had a small amount left.

review_title: Smaller breed? Cut them into fourths!
review_body: I used this product when I trained my chiweenie more than four years ago as a puppy and recently purchased them again to train the new addition to our household, a french bullweenie! These treats are a good size for a large breed puppy as they are about 1/2 inch by 1/2 inch big. For smaller breed dogs that average about 2-5 pounds during early puppyhood when you are potty training and teaching basic commands/tricks, they are much too large. I cut the treats with scissors yielding four smaller treats and those are perfect for smaller mouths! Not only are they more palatable at that size but you can get a longer training session in without your pup getting full and ruining their dinner. I wonder if the number of negative reviews about diarrhea and tummy upset in their pup from these treats is because they were feeding too many or too large of pieces for their dog? Our pup is about 3 pounds currently and we typically do one to two short training sessions a day with her as well as reward occasionally for proper pottying using these treats giving her on average 8-12 bite sized, or 2-3 full size, treats a day. She has not had any ill effects from them, nor did the chiweenie years ago.

My pup LOVES these treats! Regular biscuits are a little too hard for the pup still, these are nice and soft for those baby teeth  and make for the perfect treat, she can easily chew down. They break in half easily, and added bonus they fit in my KONG treat nicely to keep her occupied! I think these are going to be a valuable tool in training my new pup!

I think I've collected 7 of these now, in a variety of colors, and they're perfect. In addition for a fantastic array of colors they've also stood up quite well to rigorous use by our 65 lb. labrador who isn't at all delicate. I like the bombproof buckle closure and all of the stitching has been beyond reproach. Not haute couture by any stretch, but exactly what I was looking for. I've found other collars of similar quality but the Blueberry scores points for the palette they offer and at a very reasonable price.

review_title: Did not work for my dog ):
review_body: Got this for my dog that freaks out in the car. I thought it would be a good idea and safer for when I was taking him to the vet or dog park alone. However, he always ends up stepping on the release button within a minute of our dive and is loose anyway. The good news is that it takes him a while to realize this. Other than this issue, it seems to be made of a durable material.
Great color for a great price that has held up well so far; been using for a month. Would absolutely buy again

Great collar. Only flaw is it's difficult to adjust. The blueberry label is thick, in the way, and makes it hard to adjust smaller. This size fit good for our 10 month old lab. Great color options too!

After owning the product for less then 2 months the collar the plastic collar connector crack.  It made it impossible to unfasten the collar from my dogs neck. There is only a 30 day return policy but it should last for years.  This is first time this has happened to any of the dog collars I have owned.

review_title: X-small perfect for Boston terrier pup!
review_body: Feels high quality and will totally be something my pup can grow into! The clasp is also much easier than other brands I've used in the past for my older girl. Super satisfied with the lavender. We also purchased a leash in the same color, same brand for the matching effect. Both are great quality and better prices than in stores!

Bought 6 of these collars and leashes to match for a litter of puppies as their first collar and leash and for leash training. They held up to rough play and the fit was perfect for them as they grew. The buckle stayed secure which is plus in my eyes when a dog is on leash...I have had other break even on small dogs.

A good basic collar. Nothing fancy, but quality is good and the color is right on. Our girl dog looks great in her new dark orchid purple collar. Big box pet stores have similar collars but are more expensive. Blueberry has a way better color selection.

Collar is nice but upset they decided the blueberry tag was more important than actual dog info. Bought medium and in order to for part of phone number is in buckle. Went back to our Kong collars with a tag clamped on. Really need to think more on placement and priority of dog info

review_title: Perfect replacement for my 38 lb. Dog
review_body: I ordered the Medium for my "German Spitz" dog. She is approx. 38 lbs and this was a perfect fit. Not sure if it would fit a larger dog in this size. The Purple color looks as pictured. Now the problem is putting it on my Dog. lol  She is running away from me.

review_title: I ENJOY WELLNESS PRODUCTS FOR MY LITTLE GUY
review_body: JUST RECEIVED YESTERDAY....SEEMS OK ( HE'S ONLY HAD ONE SO FAR, AND OF COURSE HE ATE IT VERY QUICKLY, OF COURSE ).  MY GUY HASN'T EVER HAD THESE BUT, I ENJOY WELLNESS PRODUCTS FOR MY LITTLE GUY. I'M PROTECTIVE OF MY DOGGIE SO, MY POINT IS...I BELIEVE THEY WILL BE PERFECT FOR ME/HIM. I TYPICALLY MAKE HIS TREATS BUT, I THOUGHT I WOULD TRY THESE TO GIVE HIM SOMETHING DIFFERENT. I ALSO DON'T GIVE MY DOG TREATS ALL DAY, EVERY DAY SO, ANYTHING TREAT WISE HE'S GOING TO APPRECIATE. BUT AGAIN, I DO TRUST "WELLNESS".

My Cavalier King Charles Spaniel girls love these healthy grain free low calorie treats. I've been using these since I brought my girls home about eight months ago. I have an auto delivery once a month for two packages. The treats have helped them learn all kinds of tricks and are used as rewards when showing agility in the 4h. We don't treat for commands of behavior like sit stay and bed but if we did I'm certain we'd need more packs per month. The treats have always been consistent in softness and I personally think they smell good. The only con is that the size is not always consistent and you may get a few small treats in the bag.

review_title: Great for our Italian Greyhound puppy!
review_body: These were great for our 3 and 1/2 month old Italian Greyhound mix! He loved them more than any treats we've given him so far. And they smell great, like beef jerky! But they are kind of big for training treats. There are about 50 treats in the bag. We chopped them up into much smaller pieces (about 9 smaller cubes from 1 treat). I don't know why companies make the treats so big. They are supposed to be just big enough for scent, taste, and reward, so you only need enough for a nibble at a time, but a whole bunch for nibbles for each successful behavior.

My teacup puppy love these! I cut each one up in four portions so that I can use them as training treats otherwise it would take too much time for wait for him to chew and get back to training. They smell DELICIOUS! (No, I did  not try any!) His stool is not questionable after eating these and it is healthy! No unnecessary additives! Buying them online is a lot cheaper than Petsmart. I think I paid almost $6 for the same pack! Online, it was about $3.50 as an add-on!

My 2 10 week old Saint Pyrenees puppies love these. They barely have any teeth so regular treats are hard for them to eat. These are perfect! you can also find them at PetCo if you’re looking for them in the store.

review_title: Can't speak for every dog, but mine loved these.
review_body: Very expensive for the amount you get, but if you can afford them, I am almost certain your dog will like them.  Mine would do tricks over and over again to earn one, it was crazy.  I did break them into smaller pieces for my little Yorkie, but they are very soft so it was easy to do.  I would recommend them if you don't mind the price, I am looking for something different personally.

review_title: Safe and awesome for very young pups.
review_body: It was hard finding a treat to potty train my puppies. Most of the treats in the stores recommend them for puppies 5 months and older. Mine were only 3 months old. These treats were great and perfect size for training. My dogs were obsessed with them which helped a lot! The treats have a division down the middle which I love since it helps to break them into two tiny pieces for training. The ingredients are great and they didn't upset either of my little puppie's tummies. These are great soft first time treats especially if they have hardly any teeth.

Earlier I reviewed my dogs favorite dog food, now it's time to give 5 stars to her favorite treat.  She is a rescue from a puppy mill and I have spent the last year building trust.  I have purchased several foods and treats watching her reaction with the introduction of each.  You can tell when it is consumed just because they are hungry and when they are excited and happy because they love what you just gave them.  I have purchased and then given away several dog foods and treats that she didn't seem to care for unless she was just hungry.  When I pick up these treats she comes alive, jumps around wagging her tail and that makes me happy too.

The healthiest treat I have been able to convince my chi's to eat. Even my older guy who was taught by previous owners to only like junk food loves these! Not quite a supplement, but still more than just a snack. I call these "cookies" since they truly have a texture more akin to a moist cereal bar or soft bakery style cookie. I broke them in half for my youngest chi when she was smaller, but it wasn't necessary. Hasn't caused tear staining beyond normal, either.

review_title: Great for new puppies and full grown dogs as well!
review_body: My morkie loves these treats! I used them a lot when she was still a puppy and teething but she now has all her big dog teeth and she still loves them! They're soft so they're easy to tear into smaller pieces to give as rewards. They're also scored so you can easily rip them in half. I highly recommend these, I've repurchased 2 bags already because she went through her first so quickly!
Bought this for our 18 pound cat. Fits great. He likes it too.

This works great. Buckles right into the seat belt, just long enough for her to look out the window but not stick her head out. She can’t get into the front or anything, and I believe I have it set at mid length. Super strong and has clipped into every car seat buckle I have tried.
Looks beautiful and has fit her very well. I just ordered the next size up in a different pattern from Blueberry since she's about two days from growing out of this.

review_title: Even after a year it was still in very nice condition considering he spends most of his time playing ...
review_body: Very basic and cute. They last long, my puppy used it up until he was a year old and the only reason we got a new one was because he outgrew it. Even after a year it was still in very nice condition considering he spends most of his time playing in the river, rolling in mud, digging and rolling in tall grass.

Love the color, it's so vibrant! I ordered a size Small for my chihuahua/terrier mix and it fit her good with a little adjusting. I really like the thickness of it and it doesn't seem to bother her like her last collar did. Like others, I wish it had an extra loop her name tag but we made it work.

review_title: Not well sewn and could scratch dog's next
review_body: This is the worst dog collar I have ever seen.  The embroidered name of the dog is sewn through to the back side with scratchy thread, so it rubs against the dog's neck.  Maybe a furry dog would not be bothered, but I have a very small short-hair dog and it was extremely uncomfortable for him. I threw it away the same day I got it.

review_title: I would like to start off by saying how impressed i was ...
review_body: I would like to start off by saying how impressed i was with how fast I received this collar!! I got the neon coral color and it looks beautiful on my lab, the quality of the stitching is great. I am just super happy!! I bought a large and it fits great with ample room for her as she grows

review_title: We got them in bright colors so that when we take the dogs to the beach they are easy to spot from a bit of a distance
review_body: These collars are very durable. We got them in bright colors so that when we take the dogs to the beach they are easy to spot from a bit of a distance.

review_title: PetSmart and sime I don’t remember - a collar for my little guy that I love! I will def order these for him from ...
review_body: Finally, after 3 years and multiple purchases - online, Walmart, Target, PetSmart and sime I don’t remember -  a collar for my little guy that I love! I will def order these for him from now on.

Love love love this! The price is perfect and honestly if I went to my local pet store this would be triple the price. I cant say enough good things about it. Love the hunter green color - I wanted a military color and this worked great!

review_title: A MUST for All new puppy.l
review_body: I don't know what it is about this "treat", but it's the main snack my Shih tzu wants. In fact, every time I get a box delivered, he has his little 13lb. self right there trying to get me to open it faster. Each piece is flat, about the size of your thumbnail, & soft (but not floppy or wet). I break each one in half before I give them to him in hopes of making them last longer, as I think he would eat the whole bag if I let him. My only wish is that they put more in the bags. If you're only giving them 4-6 of them daily, they may last a wk. But, it's been a tried & true love for my Luke, who's been enjoying them since his teeth started really coming in. The extra plus for me is peace of mind that they aren't going to cut or get lodged in his throat like some of the other treat options out there. Hope your puppy loves them as much as mine does!

review_title: these seem to be her favorite - when I let her pick between different types ...
review_body: I get a lot of different types of treats so Ripley will have some variety in her rewards when we train. So far, these seem to be her favorite - when I let her pick between different types of treats, these are the ones she usually goes for.

With a name like wellness, you'd think they'd have the dogs interest at heart, but just like almost all the rest, they've got to add things that some dogs can't tolerate... The label says "all Natural" but then they add Smoke Flavoring to the product to lure the owner.  Both my dogs develop severe gastritis and diarrhea from "smoke flavorings" and I'm sure they aren't the only two. I was in a hurry and only scanned the ingredients list.  I give myself the ONE STAR for not looking closer at ingredients list when I ordered.  Wellness is another product i can strike off my shopping list.

review_title: Excellent texture for training - chewy but firm, not crumbly or messy
review_body: My puppy loves these! And so does my 10 year old dog.

review_title: He still loved them and would perform tricks for the treats but ...
review_body: This may not necessarily be a problem with the product, could just be our puppies preference, but it because noticeable that he would throw up on nights he ate these treats. He still loved them and would perform tricks for the treats but they may have been upsetting his tummy. Additionally, we didn’t necessarily like feeding these to him because of the smell..  I know they are fish but these were pretty stinky still lol
Made my dog sick. My little Rosey threw up. They might have been too rich for her belly, but I thought it was a good product.  I tossed them out.

I have three dogs that I do obedience with and these treats are the best! They're soft and have lines on them where you can break them up into smaller pieces for training and the dog doesn't have to stop and chew it up so there is no break in your training to interrupt focus! Awesome for small dogs too because you Can rip it in little pieces, my Pomeranian goes nuts for them!They are designed for puppies so they are easy on the stomach and taste great for the dog! I love the quality of the wellness brand and they use good quality ingredients without all the fillers most treats have!

review_title: My small dogs love these but I wanted them for training and they ...
review_body: My small dogs love these but I wanted them for training and they are a bit too big for that. They come in soft squares scored into four sections, so I cut them up along the score lines to make four training sized pieces out of each wafer, but that got tiresome after a while. Still, they are more tasty to my dogs than the Crazy Dog Train-me! Mini Bites I tried as an alternative, so I might go back to them.

review_title: Some of the best treats around and SUPER healthy!
review_body: These are some of the best puppy treats I have ever tried!  I used to work at a pet store and would recommend them to everyone with a puppy. They are made by a great, natural, holistic brand and contain wholesome ingredients, including DHA, which is great for puppy's development. They are very soft and flat, which makes it easy to tear into smaller pieces for training. They are quite smelly (smell of bacon and fish almost), but the dogs (and even my cat) LOVE the smell of them. My dog is excited to train because of these treats. They are WELL worth the price; there's more in there than it looks, and the fact that you can tear them up makes them last even longer. Try them yourself! I guarantee your dog will go crazy for them

Puppy loved them but apparently his stomach did not!  He has slept through the night since he was 8 weeks old (now he is 12 weeks) and after using these for training (which I really liked them for training because they are so soft and easy to break into even smaller pieces), he was up every 2 hours with almost pure liquid bowel movements!

I bought a large for my American Bulldog mix, and probably should have ordered a medium. This is my fault for not measuring her neck before placing my order, I just assumed she'd be a large.  The collar is beautiful, I love it!!  Lime green with Purple letters, looks awesome!

review_title: I like the softness of the collar instead of so stiff
review_body: I like the softness of the collar instead of so stiff.  It's easy to adjust the length.  But, the problem is it fading after about 1-1/2 months of putting it on my pup.  He is not a ground roller for it to get dirty and even then it could be washed.  The area on the top of the neck where the collar lays around the neck has faded and it's quite noticeable!  I also bought the orange leash so now I have to find a new orange collar that is a disappointment!!  This particular Blueberry collar is not as good as others I have purchased.  BUMMED!!

So far so good. I used this the day after I got it when I went hiking at the Red River Gorge and it held up as I expected any leash to hold up. Nice color selections, accurate to description, reasonably priced. Overall, I’m happy, and I’d say my dog (who basically never wears a collar) is happy also.

review_title: I bought the yellow and love the color
review_body: I bought the yellow and love the color. It's very bright. I had originally ordered a large assuming that I could make the collar smaller and adjust it as my puppy grows. It couldn't be adjusted to a smaller size because the "Blueberry" tag got in the way. The medium fits my 40 pound dog well but the large was way too big.

I’m using this collar to hold bandanas for my cat to wear. That said, if this wasn’t to hold a bandana I would not use this as a primary collar. The black clasp is really difficult to buckle and unbuckle. Not an easy collar to get on and off my cat. The XS was the right size though.

This collar is great, the color is vivid and truly beautiful! The only thing that bugs me is that the collar adjusts itself, and by that I mean, when my 8-10 pound Silky/Maltese mix runs around or shakes his head it gets bigger on his neck. I am constantly checking and readjusting to make sure the collar doesn't slip off his neck when we go outside, or when I am about to leave because I don't want him to chew it, but other than that the collar is great.

Nice, but I wish there a way to hold the dog in the center of the seat. Like a strap coming from each side. Way too easy for the dog to get slammed against the door or window if stopping quick, but I don’t see a better option anywhere.

We have this collar in several colors and have always been happy with them.  They quality is great so is the fit.  I ordered this one in hopes if it really be orange as it says it's orange.  It's not...it's more of a coral color.

Our dog hiking service asked for owners to replace buckle collars w/ nylon collars w/ quick release clasp (for ease of emergency removal).  This collar is relatively soft on the edge, easy to adjust length and has held up well.

review_title: Nice colors. Substantial feel but clasp failed in the ...
review_body: Nice colors. Substantial feel but clasp failed in the closed position and it would not release. Finally cut it off my dog. When I finally got it apart, there was a little burr/ridge of plastic on one side that caused it to fail by not being able to push in fully, therefore not releasing.  I have others of this brand on my other dogs and no problems with them.

review_title: Holy Grail treat for my pup
review_body: This is a high reward treat for my 18lb Border Collie. She is 4 months old so I do cut it into smaller pieces. It does smell fishy because of the salmon but it is tolerable and did not make me gag. Of all the training treats I've tried, this is the holy grail, her manners are on point when she smells this one where as with other treats she acts like she has selective memory. We've tried Merricks, Pet Botanics, other farmer's market price gouging types and this is still her absolute favorite. If you don't have enough in your order for same day delivery or just want it right now, get it at Petco. It's about the same price usually or they will price match.

review_title: Great for training, especially for older dogs!
review_body: Both of my boys love these.  Easy to break in tiny pieces for training.  My senior dog (almost 14) especially loves them, easy to chew for him, he's been missing teeth since puppyhood.  Made in the USA, grain free (important for allergic dogs like my dudes). My guys are VERY wary of people, even those they know.  My plumber (also my Dad and their "Grandpaw") was here today installing a water softener, and these treats kept the boys engaged enough that they barely barked at him.  Eight paws and two thumbs up!

review_title: Do not buy!!!!  Contains glass shards.
review_body: Terrible!  My puppy is pretty small so I thought I would cut the bits in half.  While cutting I found glass-not just a small shard-but multiple shards plus bits of very sharp bones.  I would never buy this nor would I ever recommend it. We will be contacting Wellness Pet Foods as soon as they are open.  I'm only giving 1 star as amazon will not allow a post with zero.

review_title: I bought this product because I heard trainers recommend this product and I love the ingredients in it ...
review_body: I bought this product because I heard trainers recommend this product and I love the ingredients in it but my puppy has a hard time eating it. The texture is too gummy/rubbery, which makes it difficult to use for training because it takes too long for your puppy to finish it before going on with the training. I tried breaking them into smaller pieces than I was using but my puppy still had trouble eating it. These treats might be better for large puppies.

review_title: Easy to tear but terrible side effects
review_body: These treats came recommended by other dog owners but trying them on my puppy and now reading reviews from others including one of the same breed, I see that we're not the only ones who experienced soft or sometimes runny stools and room-clearing gas. OMG!

review_title: I'm going to miss the puppy stage
review_body: The artificial smoke ingredient in these remind me of the smell of a

I found this here on Amazon, and based on the amazing reviews and product info, I decided to let Emma try them.  She absolutely LOVES them (& she'd let me know if she didn't by just playing with it- throwing it and catching it and then walking away uninterested). I give her a few as a treat & she gives me such a sweet, sad face when I say no more tonight (dogs can really make you feel guilty lol).

review_title: My puppy will do ANYTHING for these!
review_body: Tried a few different treats for training.  My teddy bear puppy (3 lbs) LOVES these.  She got tired of the others quickly, but these!!! She would do a headstand for one!  Sure is helping with the potty training.  I usually cut them in half and leave them in small plastic containers all over the place so that I have a treat as soon as she does something wonderful.  Very pleased with this purchase.

These treats are great and I love the smell of Salmon when I open the bag. Our puppy also loves them. She gets a 1/4 square for doing good deeds while she is learning her tasks. Some are complaining about their dog getting soft stool or diarrhea, I would give the dog a smaller piece, I don't think a dog needs the full square. We are praising them for a good deed/task that they are learning.

review_title: DO NOT PURCHASE - ALL DOGS SICK
review_body: I used to love these treats, but they must have changed the ingredients because recently purchased packages have made all of my dogs and puppies sick, almost immediately. This was even more upsetting because the puppies were already underweight. I've very disappointed because these used to be great. I DO NOT RECOMMEND PURCHASING THESE ANYWHERE, not just through Amazon but also at any store. I bought some from Petco that had the same problem.

review_title: which is considered large by the vet) and loved it so much I bought a second one
review_body: I bought one of these for one of my cats (both are 10-11 pound cats, which is considered large by the vet) and loved it so much I bought a second one.  Very bright and vibrant colors that haven't faded after almost a year.  They also haven't frayed at all, even with lots of cleaning and scratching!  It's hard finding pretty and sturdy non-breakaway collars.  I initially didn't like that there was the blueberry logo on the side, but it's not as noticeable as I thought.

review_title: If you have a dog or cat.......you must get one of these.
review_body: Took our first road trip last week and this worked great.  It just seemed to be more safe than the others I have tried.  I use it with his harness and now I feel like he is just as protected as I am with my seat belt.  Good product. Thanks.

It arrived and fit our dog perfectly. Everything was exactly as I had ordered it.  People have commented on how easy it is to read her name and number. She goes to daycare and we preferred this over a metal tag.  She wears it everywhere including swimming, it has not frayed or faded.

I foster lots of dogs in a years time. Bought three of these for some puppies I was fostering. All the puppies itched with these. I tried them again when they were 12 weeks old and they started itching again within one day. Will not buy again!

review_title: Sturdy material! Better than store brands!
review_body: Love this collar for our new adopted pup!  We were looking for not a “typical” color and they nailed it! The collar is sturdy yet comfortable on him.  We will be ordering again from this company as our fur baby family will grow!

My husband and I purchased these collars (and matching leashes) for our two large breed dogs, one in pink and one in the lighter blue shade. They are brightly colored and perfect for writing on (we write our dogs name and our phone numbers in sharpie on their collars). The material is not too thick and does not look chunky on our dogs necks, it is thin but study and our dogs seem to be comfortable in them. The clasp is made of black plastic and functions well. We purchased leashes in the same colors and they matched up perfectly! We have had these for a while now (about 3 months) and the colors have not faded. We have bought collars from pet stores in the past but we will be buying these from now on, they are great!

It’s very thick and sturdy. I got the personalized one and the lettering has to fit between the buckle so you can’t see the phone number without taking it off. I got a size large for my 65 lb english pointer who just turned a year old. It’s a little large for him but I’m able to get it to fit.

Very pretty purple color.  Fits my cat well and she seems to like this material better than the leather one she use to have. My guess would be  because this material is breathable making all day/night wearing more cool and comfortable for her.  Doesn't seem to tangle her Maine Coon mane which is nice during her daily brush.  She has had this collar on for sever months now and its still looks brand new.

Doesn’t stay buckled...I got out of the car and wasn’t really paying attention because I had buckled my dog-before I knew it she was jumping through my drivers side door and I had to catch her, yikes! (This happened twice but I was ready for the potential escape to happen the second time around)

review_title: Love them! They are lovely! I own multiple!
review_body: I have probably 6 of these Blueberry collars and my dog Sam and I love them! He has different colors for different months. I will say that I ordered a teal colored collar, and it seems to be more of a baby blue. They all are greatly made, sturdy and bright! Love love love

These are perfect dog treats...and my dogs are BIG dogs and no longer puppies.  With dogs it's not the size that matters, just the yummy taste.  And this must fit the bill because the readily feel "treated" when they get one of these.  Good especially if you're training a puppy, or if you're trying not to add too many "empty calories" to your dog's diet.

review_title: My puppy loves the flavor and they're made in the USA. Good stuff!
review_body: My puppy (4 month old maltipoo) loves the flavor of these, and given their unique ingredients and healthy formulation, they are working well in my current treat rotation of Zuke's Mini Naturals Dog Treats, Old Mother Hubbard Puppy Classic Crunchy Biscuits, and these. I myself love that these treats are made in the USA with healthy natural ingredients that are a change-up from the normal chicken and beef-based stuff he eats. I also love that they are made specifically for puppies, which seems to be unique for small and soft type dog treats.

review_title: Great for training and my 10 week old loves them!
review_body: I've been giving these to my Australian Shepherd pup since she was 7 weeks old. She is now 10 weeks and they've been great! I see other people talking about digestive issues but she hasn't experienced any of those. We did get her from a breeder who already weaned and introduced purina puppy chow in her diet 100% so I'm not sure if that had anything to do with it. They're soft enough to break into little pieces which was great because when we first got her, her mouth was too small to take a full treat. She LOVES them! We use them for positive reinforcement in potty and obedience training, and to introduce her to her crate in a positive way. I've gone through almost two bags already and will be getting more!

I have a 10 week old puppy and was looking for a safe/healthy way to reward his training. I read so many positive reviews on this product and so, I went for it. I can confirm that these are great! The reviews are accurate and my puppy loves them! Whenever he comes in from outside, he immediately looks for the bag. He hasn't gotten sick or had any bad reactions to them.

My puppy loves these treats he's a german shepherd and the first time I gave him these were when he was 7 weeks old and he loved them. He starts listening and paying attention right when he sees the bag. I use these to teach him commands and he listens and learns. At the pet store they have those treats out in the open but he won't eat those. So idk if he's a picky dog or not but I do know he loves these. These are the only ones I have tired.

These treats are perfect. They are soft so you can decide whether to split it into pieces or give the entire thing to your dog. I bought these for my puppy when he was 8 weeks old and still use them when he is 6 months old. I trained my dog with this and its great. However if you do by it at petco or petsmart it costs like $7 which is ridiculous so its best to have it on autoship on amazon and it only costs me $3.65 per month. I love it and now I don't have to worry about buying treats.

I have a Yorkie puppy who is full of energy and growing fast.  Lucy is only 4 pounds and I wanted something healthy to train her.  These were perfect.  Not too hard, and it is a treat that she cannot swallow in one gulp.  She is now potty trained and sits on command.  I love the fact that this is a good quality treat.  I would highly recommend this treat.

I just recently adopted a pup almost a week ago and I had bought a ton of treats for her and she wouldn't eat any of them, which I still have. After reading these reviews, I thought most of the people were exaggerating but I just received the treats less than an hour ago and gave her one and she INSTANTLY took it out of my hand and ate it with no issues at all!! That says a lot. I guess I'll be buying a lot more.

review_title: My dogs love them now. (didn't at first)
review_body: Revision of previous review. My dogs now won't leave me alone if I have these in my pocket. They love them and are much quicker  and more willing to learn. Definitely buying these again.

We purchased these for our new lab pup. They are perfect little bites for training. We have other treats that are soft, but I like having crunchy treats for certain training. Will purchase again. I will say they are a bit large for her right now (leaves a mess on the floor that she quickly cleans up), but they will be the perfect size here in a few weeks!

I stumbled onto the Blueberryy Pet company but really like their quality and selection of colors. My dog really likes to go swimming, play in puddles, sing in the rain... Basically anything involving water he loves. His collar and harness (same company) both dry quickly and don't smell. Even if they start to smell I can wash them on gentle. :)

review_title: Better than what you see at PetSmart
review_body: Purchased a bright new collar for my Collie mix and he is thrilled. Easily adjustable and fits true to size that was listed online. Only has one hook attachment so I have to clip his leash to where his pet tag hangs but that's no worry for me. It may be for people that have rhinestone tags though, because your leash clip can rub against the tag. However, a really nicely done collar at a really affordable price. An almost identical collar at PetSmart was $8 more than this -- so glad I found this one online.

review_title: The item I received was great in color and looked super cute on my dog
review_body: The item I received was great in color and looked super cute on my dog. The clasp seems strong and sturdy. The collar is a good width and looks comfortable on my dog. However the rubber brand label was poorly stitched on and fell off the collar just minutes after I put the collar on my dog. The missing label made all these threads exposed and it looked tattered and crappy.

Overall this is a nice collar that is easily adjustable and not very bulky.  The material is of good quality.  I do wish that it had a separate loop attachment for dog tags, but that is something of a minor issue.  It's a very good collar for the money.

The XS size fit my Italian greyhound puppy great. The collar got a tiny snag on it while my older dog was playing with the puppy but her nails were long and sharp at the time and the collar hasn't snagged again since then. I was worried about getting a light color because I didn't want it to get dingy but it's been two months so far and it's not turned dingy yet. Overall a good quality collar for a fraction of the price you'd pay at a pet store.

review_title: I had to guess with the size but FYI this ...
review_body: I had to guess with the size but FYI this is waaaaaay to big on my 8 week old German Shepherd Puppy so if you have or are getting a large breed puppy you should get a smaller size. Otherwise it has been holding up to walks and other training with the little dude.

This fit my 16 pound dog nicely, and I was happy to have a color choice that wasn't ultra masculine or ultra feminine. The only thing I would change is to make the brand name smaller, especially on the small collars. Thank you!

Super cute collars. Thinner than I expected, but that's probably just in comparison to the old collars our dogs had.
