review_body: Pupper loves these treats! They are nice and soft so easily breakable for training purposes. We all like them so much we subscribe and save to them!

Favorite puppy training treats! They must be delicious because our puppy will definitely follow commands for them and I like that they are quick  & easy for herto eat so as not to distract from training. Plus it's nice they are not as bad as other junk out there for her system.
My dog loves these treats! Theyre perfect for training new tricks. Soft and nutritious - I wish they came in a larger package!

review_title: Plastic piece in food so watch out
review_body: So overall the puppy likes these treats. We tear them up into smaller pieces because she is small. One treat had a very sharp, clear piece of plastic inside it that was not visible from the outside. If she had eaten it, it might have done damage to her because she is only a puppy. She likes the way it tastes but now I will always inspect the food for plastic and I suggest you do to.

My dogs love these.  I have tried a lot of different treats but these are definitely one of my dogs favorite ones.  The dogs also really like the scent of them.  When I take these to our training class, even the other dogs around us can smell them and they want to try them as well.  I definitely recommend these for training puppies.  They are soft and moist, you can break them into smaller pieces to make them go further.

These treats are gluten free and easy to use for training.  They're gummy, so you can tear off little bits of the treat to make smaller ones.  I almost never give my puppy the full treat because she's only 9 pounds.
THESE ARE EXCELLENT FOR TRAINING. I BREAK THEM IN 4 PIECES SINCE MY PUPPY WEIGHS LESS THAN 3 LBS. SHE WILL DO ANYTHING FOR A TREAT AND THAT'S A GREAT TRAINING TOOL

These treats are not 'system compatible' with puppies and gave both our 8 week old GSD's severe diarrhea for days afterwards. Be kind to your pets and stick with using their own kibble as treats and training rewards as this product almost sent ours to the ER vet.

review_title: My dog loves these and they are great for training
review_body: Great. My dog loves these and they are great for training. They have a strong smell to them but my puppy ate them right up.

Our puppy is pretty selective with treats. Even with lamb lung, she has to think about whether or not she wants to work for it. These puppy bites though, SHE LOVES THEM! And honestly, when I open the bag, it smells delicious so I know why she goes nuts. Definitely give these a try if your puppy isn't as food driven like ours.
Bought a couple of these and we love them. Not too expensive and they hold up nice and clean up good too

Good quality collar, have gone through several different collars with my cat who likes to shred it when he scratches himself, so far this one is holding up much better than others. No "colored fur" look going on around his neck from loose threads on the collar. :)

Product as described. A pet product line (collars, harnesses and leashes) that grows with your dog in convenient incremental sizes. Colors will adventually begin to fade with time, use and washing. Very happy with products and have bought multiple items from them.
Well made, seems durable, and the lettering shows clearly.  I'll buy another when she outgrows this one.

review_title: Awesome price for a personalized collar
review_body: We have purchased 3 of these collars.  Awesome price for a personalized collar!!!  Great quality. SUPER fast shipping. Colors are exactly as shown.
I got these in yellow so they'll be easy to find in my black interior car.  Very well made with adjustable length.  Perfect.
It's a good color- but, too small for my little guy. Followed the sizing chart, but was not big enough, cannot use.
Beware! This collar runs small. Do not trust the size chart.
The clasp on this collar is now stuck and we can’t get it off our dog’s neck. We’ve had it for 2 months. Not happy!
I got a turquoise collar for my red colored dog. She was excited to put it on. She likes new things.
My 55-lb puppy will do anything for these treats. He just loves them, and they are the right size to fit in my pocket during training sessions!

This stuff I’m not sure exactly what they put inside it lol but this stuff my puppies love it!!!! I have a chihuahua puppy and a beagle puppy and they go crazy for this stuff jumping up and down !!!! This will be great for training

review_title: Reasonably priced,  tasty, grain free, can be broken into smaller sizes
review_body: They are grain free, are doft chews so you can break them into smaller pieces so as to not over feed the puppy. They do last reasonably long time
When I ordered these, I was a little skeptical. I mean.. who orders their snacks online? But its 2014, and I'm trying to do more of my grocery shopping online, so I decided to give it a try.

review_title: These are great puppy treats especially for training
review_body: These are great puppy treats especially for training! We got our puppy and started trading right away, I wanted something natural and soft enough for him to easily chew-the wellness brand is great and they're the perfect size for training! I will be buying more!

review_title: Love these! I have a rottweiler
review_body: Love these! I have a rottweiler, and she chokes on regular training treats but not these!

When first getting our mini Aussie, I wanted to get her the best products possible. Of course, I love amazon! So I came across these - which reviews stated were great with training. They were so right! My little Mia has become so picky with treats because she’s so in love with these soft little salmon pieces. I had to subscribe to them because she loves them so so much! Only downfall is the price for the small package. It was great training her with these treats!! Worth the price.
My puppy LOVES these treats!! My friends dogs love them too!

review_title: My 3yo Pit/Shepherd mix rescue has tooth loss and loves ...
review_body: My 3yo Pit/Shepherd mix rescue has tooth loss and loves these soft bites, also seems to go nutty for the funkiness of the fishy salmon aroma which is quite pungent (be warned they are stinky).

review_title: Puppy and older dogs love them
review_body: My dogs love these. I have smaller dogs. 2 older ones and a puppy. They all loved them. They are very small, which makes it good for amall dolls, and they are very soft as well, so makes chewing easy. My dogs come running when they hear the package open.

review_title: Cute collar. I got the extra small size for ...
review_body: Cute collar.  I got the extra small size for my new puppy.  The baby pink color is slightly peachy.
SO cute! Got the small teal one for my husky/tamaskan puppy :)
This is a great, high-quality collar. Very nice color and material, and is easily adjustable. Looks great on my large dog—a Lab/Hound mix. I would definitely purchase another in the future.

review_title: Nice variety of colors to choose from
review_body: Nice variety of bright colors to choose from for both the collars and the lettering. My golden retriever and lab-mix are not bothered wearing these collars, so they must be comfortable...they just leave them alone. And I like not hearing the jingling sound of metal dog tags. Their name and our phone number fits perfectly and the font color is highly visible if they ever get lost.

review_title: I loved this collar when we first received it
review_body: I loved this collar when we first received it. It was the perfect color and looked nice and sturdy for our dog who loves to run outside. Unfortunately after only two months, the side of the collar has started to fray and come apart. After only two months, it's pretty disappointing that it's already coming apart. I would think it might hold another month or two before it becomes annoying enough for me to have to go buy another one.

review_title: Plastic junk, do not waste your money
review_body: Worst collar ever, my dog was able to get it off and chewd it so it isn't too secure as far as locking, plastic junk
Does its job
I wanted a collar that was good quality that wasn’t overly priced. This collar is absolutely perfect for that.

Surprizingly right fit. Great shipping. Right price. My only reason for the lack of the 5th star is their lack of colors available and that what I thought I ordered was more a pink than a red, but it is hard to judge colors online. I would ( and have) bought a few.
Like the bright green color to make my black dog more visible.  Fits well.  Wish you make a quick release handled leash to match.
Great training treats. Soft and chewy which is great for those evil teething months. Easy to break into smaller piece (dog does not need to know ..).

review_title: Perfect healthy treats for my puppy!
review_body: They smell really good, ingredients look safe and healthy. They are a perfect soft & chewy texture for my little Boston pup. He loves them. They’re a little big in size for him now. So I split them in half for him.

review_title: May work for some owners, not for me
review_body: Why so many unneeded ingredients?  Especially the garlic - this is a mystery to me.  Dogs are happy with simple flavors.

review_title: After trying other treats that my puppy, a blue ...
review_body: After trying other treats that my puppy, a blue heeler, refused every time, we tried these crunchy treats and have not tried anything else since. He is the kind of pup who enjoys the satisfaction of a crunch, which this gives. He has been enjoying these treats since 11 weeks old. The only downside to any crunchy treat this small is the inability to cut it in half to make them last longer for training purposes or smaller for tinier mouths. At this point if I gave him half he would probably give me a knowing accusatory look.
My puppy loves these!  They are soft and easy for her to eat.  Also, a great price for a healthy treat!  On my second purchase.

My dog is older than a puppy, but he loves these soft chews. They must smell a lot better than hard treats, because when I open the bag from another room he comes running. They work great for training, you can easily break them into smaller pieces for repetition tasks.
Dogs love these treats. (Don’t think there any treats dogs don’t love though) These are great for training purposes because they are small and can also be broken up.

Love the product, tried reordering even set-up a subscription but it said it wouldn’t be here till June 1 and I need them now for training. So I canceled and they said I can’t buy unless I spend $25 but I had just done that when I set up subscription. Bottom line I can’t buy your products

review_title: ... my puppies spit them out and looked at me like I was crazy
review_body: At first my puppies spit them out and looked at me like I was crazy. They will eat them now but only because they just swallow them so the others don't get it.

Great for training! My pup is 3 months old and I've been buying these for him since he was 6 weeks old. In that time frame he has learned sit, lay down, high five, wait, come, and kennel. We are currently working on rollover. These treats give him the motivation and reward he needs.

review_title: Really like it but had to take off the "blueberry" so ...
review_body: Really like it but had to take off the "blueberry" so I could make it small enough for my dog's neck.

review_title: Looks great. I have it on my strong pit bull ...
review_body: Looks great. I have it on my strong pit bull mix who is a major puller, so we use a harness for walking. It’s held up for about 2 months now, but I’m nervous to put too much strain on it. Does the job fine.
My dog chewed this collar up pretty quickly.  I have not had a lot of luck with Blueberry brand collars.  I won't purchase again in the future.

review_title: Great collar. It has worked great for my boxer ...
review_body: Great collar. It has worked great for my boxer during her rapid growth. It fit her on it's tightest setting when we first got her at 8 weeks and now at 5 months she is close to growing out of it. Very durable.
Beautiful and well made collar.  Please measure your dog’s neck and and use the sizing chart.  I didn’t, and the collar is far too big.

Nothing to dislike about this collar. My new puppy just grew out of it quickly not only in length but it was very narrow on him.  He grew to 40 pounds in  less than 3 months.. I don't recommend it for a puppy that will be a large dog soon.
Love this collar! It was the perfect size for my dog and I love the colors! I even got the matching leash! The buckle is easy to use and his tags and the leash stay on well with the ring.
Perfect! What more can I say? It's a dog collar. Fits correctly. They spelled everything correctly.
The color is great! I bought this for my shihtzu and he looks so handsome in it. Seems to be high quality. Very happy with this collar!
Love this collar!  Easily adjustable and lightweight for puppy.  The smallest size does obviously have an equally small clasp, sometimes a little hard to unlatch because it is so dainty.

review_title: They love it SO much that when it was left on ...
review_body: My dogs are the actual reviewers of this product. They love it SO much that when it was left on the table they took it and opened it, and ate every last treat.

review_title: This is a favorite treat of my finicky Westie puppy
review_body: This is a favorite treat of my finicky Westie puppy. I have used different kinds of training treat for obedience training. At the end of the day, he was always tired of them or lost interest in them, and not listened to me. But not this one. I got him third bag of this one. He hasn't been tired of it yet and still loves it.
Puppy loves them and they are awesome for training! I got stingy with my puppy and broke them up into four pieces so he would give me more attention
Finnegan loves these!

review_title: Puppy doesn't like them after raw diet.
review_body: Puppy had been eating a raw diet at the breeders and doesn't like these treats. I was going to try again in a few days.

My dogs are obsessed!! They are on wellness brand food but go crazy for these treats. Not many come in a bag for a training puppy but they are so soft u can break them up

review_title: perfect addition to his nutritional needs
review_body: using these to potty train my 11 week cockapoo. he loves them. I initially was careful because i thought that he's get fat but since i let him romp around and play after going potty it has not been an issue. perfect addition to his nutritional needs.

My puppy enjoys these. I wanted something soft for her puppy teeth as a potty training treat and she seems to enjoy these. A few reviews posted this product gave their pups the runs, but I have not had that experience with my dog. Every dog is different of course though. These are small enough to give as treats for potty training.
Puppy liked them.
Why didn't I get this sooner??!! So excited with this piece and it matches the rest. Blueberry pets is great!!! Thank you!
Pretty carnation pink color, especially with her bandanas. Sturdy and durable as always! Love Blueberry products.
Fit my shih tzu perfectly and the color is vibrant.

Bought this for our new addition to the family in a size small. I got the blue one and it is bright and perfect. I plan on buying another one. when i first got this i wanted to just it on him now then he'll grow out of it and i was going to buy him a leather collar. But so far i am loving this.

review_title: Bought this for my oes puppy. It was almost ...
review_body: Bought this for my oes puppy. It was almost too big at 8 weeks old but now she is 15 weeks old and will need a new collar in a couple weeks.

This collar is fantastic! I have tried a couple of other collars in the past for my toy poodle, and this is the only one that he hasn’t tried to chew up. I also like that the information is on the actual collar instead of hanging from a tag. Great quality and I like the color too.
We have not had any issues with the color, it fits great and seems to be made to last.

These are great collars. Had them for about a month or two for my Beagles and so far so good. The colors are vibrant. I can't speak to durability yet, past the two months, but I will update should there be negative changes.
I love this! It's very nicely made and the colors are bright! I got red with blue writing and it stands out well.
If you have a pup who needs to be on a grain-free diet, these are great. We’ve got an 8 month old Frenchie, and he loves the soft bites. They’re just the right size.

review_title: My puppy loooooooves this stuff.. Sometimes when he ...
review_body: My puppy loooooooves this stuff.. Sometimes when he won't eat I break this up and stick in his food and he gobbles everything right away..

review_title: so I would recommend cutting them in half if you're using them for ...
review_body: These treats are a little bigger, so I would recommend cutting them in half if you're using them for training. I was surprised at how little came in the package, though. I expected the package to be full of treats, like others I have purchased, but mine was just a little over half full. Disappointing, but my puppy loves them.

My puppy LOVES the salmon and lamb treats. They are nice and soft for training and if you break them up in halves or quarters the bag lasts a long time. I used them for housebreaking and she couldn't wait to go to the bathroom outside to get these treats. And it helps that they are super inexpensive and chock full of great ingredients.
My puppy loves these and is very motivated to earn them! Helped me potty train in what feels like record time.

review_title: fell apart in less than a minute
review_body: cute toy but not made well;  the seams are not well sewn and fell apart with only mild use; returned for refund
My 3 month old Shihtzu absolutely loves these treats! She gets excited every time she sees me get the bag. Very happy with this purchase and I highly recommend it.

My puppy loves these treats. I started training him around 2.5 months and they are great incentives.  I also feel very comfortable with the ingredients listed.  Will be buying more off Amazon - the stores sell these treats for double the price!

review_title: My pup LOVED these. I think they got a little stale ...
review_body: My pup LOVED these. I think they got a little stale when I left them in the treat tote though. So as long as you remember to put them BACK into the resealable bag, it should be fine.

review_title: Tempted to use on dash button
review_body: I keep ordering these over and over- my pup seems to love them and they're easy to break into smaller pieces when working on tricks etc. it's also a great brand- my dog trainer approved as well!

review_title: Adjustable collar readjusts itself - it works better if one sews it into place!
review_body: I'm rather disappointed with this collar. I have purchased "adjustable" type collars in the past and never had any difficulty with them remaining adjusted, but this one just won't stay where it's been adjusted to! After a few days of readjusting it, I gave up and sewed a few stitches into each end in order to hold it still. Since then, there have been no problems with it. Other than the collar readjusting itself, I have no complaints about the quality of it.
These collars are well made and in beautiful colors.  They perfectly fit the small necks of my two Pompoo dogs.
Fits as expected. My 90lb dog is allergic to metals and this works well for him.

review_title: The collar is as expected. Would have been 5 ...
review_body: The collar is as expected. Would have been 5 stars but one of my dogs is smaller than the other and I have to adjust the collar over the logo on the webbing. The logo is made from a rubber-like substance and it makes the collar fit weirdly

review_title: Great price, easy to customize, beautiful colors, fast shipping
review_body: I love this! I looked on Etsy for customizable collars and was about to spend $40 on an order from there when I found this steal. It was so easy to customize, arrived quickly, and the colors are very bright and vibrant! Best of all, I dont have to worry about my pup losing his tag anymore (it's happened a few times) and NO JINGLING as he moves throughout the house. 😁👍

Love the color (royal blue) but sizing hard for my 11 lb rat terrier puppy. Because of the thickness of the rubber Blueberry tag it won’t pull through and lie flat- disappointing as I like it otherwise.

Great collar for the money. I was worried that it would be flimsy or lightweight, because it was so inexpensive. But it's great, just like the one you'd buy at the pet store, but half the cost. Vibrant color and sturdy clip.
Seems made out of good materials. Has no ring to attach name tag or licenses.
These are wonderful. Sturdy, washable when you dog plays in the mud and easy to secure rabies and ID tags to.  Highly recommend for the price

review_title: Love the quality of this collar
review_body: Love the quality of this collar! We purchased a Large customized orange and purple one. We have a 108 lb German Shepherd, and it fit well. The customization was perfect. We are very happy with our purchase.

review_title: my puppy did not like them. But after a while
review_body: At first, my puppy did not like them. But after a while, he suddenly LOVES them. I have to break it up into tiny pieces so your fingers do get dirty. Since we break them up really small, a bag lasts a long time (longer than we expected).

review_title: 4 mo old Puppy LOVES these treats!
review_body: They smell like actual food, they’re soft, and they don’t have any of those nasty ingredients I’m trying to keep away from my puppy’s diet. She goes CRAZY whenever she sees the bag. I only use them for training and I tend to tear each pieces into at least three bites before giving them to her. Will definitely buy again.
My Yorkies love them and they can be picky.  Will buy again.  Easily broken into smaller pieces for training treats.
Do NOT buy for small dogs. My 4 lb puppy almost choked and died. Would not break apart and got lodged inside her. Took 12 hours and she finally threw it up.
My dogs love these and they're very soft! They smell like beef jerky. They're a little big for my 4 lb puppies, so I cut them into threes.
My pup is not very fond of these but will eat one if I hold it in my hand for her to consume.

review_title: They're easy to chew and great for training
review_body: My puppy loves the flavors and texture of these puppy bites! They're easy to chew and great for training. I love the natural ingredients that Wellness uses for their treats as well.

review_title: Great treat, puppy responds well to these.
review_body: Good soft treat.  I break mine up into quarters for my small pup.  He loves these and responds very well.  Ingredients are pretty good except the glycerin and phosphoric acid.
really nice for training because my puppy loves it!! I wish they sold bigger size lamb & salmon recipe treats, more than 3 ounces.

review_title: I let my pups sample immediately upon receiving & they were very happy with them & couldn't get enough
review_body: Received as described. Actually they arrived earlier than expected. I let my pups sample immediately upon receiving & they were very happy with them & couldn't get enough.
These fit my doxies perfectly they are good quality I was worried about how good the latch clip was, but have had no issues! Colors are also very pretty brighter then picture!

review_title: colors are great. we ordered the teal with orange stitching for ...
review_body: colors are great. we ordered the teal with orange stitching for our 10 pound cat in the size small.  i almost feel like we could have done the size extra small but he doesn't seem to mind his collar at all. the one gripe we have is that the adjuster sits right in the name portion of the stitching at the smaller size of the collar. it also greats quite a big lump in the collar that sticks out. the cat doesn't mind but it does look a bit odd.
Could not fit all the info I wanted. Materials and workmanship are excellent.
Fit my dog perfectly and unlike other ones i bought before this one doesnt bother my dog at all.
Color just pops on my dog and fits good. Material is great for wear and tear but will absorb order so may need to be washed but after an extensive period of time.

Kind of difficult to adjust maybe because i have weak arms. Love the color options, looks great on my favorite boy, doesn't slip off his head (his head is about the same width or smaller than his neck so it easily slips off his head sometimes. It's been difficult with a leather colar that kept stretching).

My all time favorite collars for my pups. I own pink and blue ones, they are durable with bright vibrant colors and easy to august. Both the groomers and the doggy day care place request that we use plastic clip on collars as apposed to the metal buckles so this product is perfect for us.
Love how this looks on my dog.

review_title: I LOVE the color (light blue) of this collar
review_body: I LOVE the color (light blue) of this collar. It is just as bright as in the picture. It is made of sturdy material and the large fits my 65 lb dog easily. I also got a large for my 45-50 lb dog and it fits him well when on as tight as it goes. Great collar option!

review_title: I love everything this company makes
review_body: I love everything this company makes. There are so many varieties but I often opt for the cheapest version of collars and harnesses--either way, extremely well made and durable for my 7 month old Pitbull.
I have a dog that belongs to my friend. She is a older dog and has a problems with her teeth and this is soft and she like them a lot .So if you have a dog with the same problem then it is worth it.

review_title: Soft, Easily Cutable To Make Smaller, My Puppy Loves!
review_body: Perfect for training! The squares are a little big in my opinion (especially for a puppy). While you always want to reinforce good behavior you also don't want to overfeed. My solution: I quartered them with a food scissor. Super easy to do and also allows you to have more snacks. Highly recommend.
My Pitbull puppy goes crazy for these treats!  They are very fragrant, with a soft texture.  I keep these on order with Subscribe and Save.

Great soft rewards that my puppy will jump completely off the ground for. He has started to tell the difference in bags and know when I'm getting these. He really is crazy over these, and the best thing is they are a healthy treat.

review_title: Easy to tear apart for training rewards
review_body: My puppy loves these treats. They are about the size of a thumbnail and soft. Easy to tear apart for quick training rewards so you don't use up the whole bag.

I have a little chihuahua mix (about 5lbs, 6mo old) puppy and I was worried this snack might of been too hard for her, thankfully snacks are soft enough for her to chew on. These are great for training, have used them to potty train her and gotten her used to her leash.

review_title: Too expensive for what you get
review_body: Too expensive for the tiny amount you get. Much more economical to make your own homemade treats. On the plus side, my dog loves them. But she eats leaves so who knows.
I give her one when she does good/right! Good training tool. She is a German/lab mix so a big girl for sure even at 5 months old.

My yorkies love these. They will be sleeping in another room and literally as soon as they hear this package no matter what they are doing or sleeping. They will run to me and sit right in front of me for some. I wish they made a huge bag of these. I'm on my 4th bag in 2 months.
a gift for a new puppy and the family says he loves these and they are great for training

We have 5 of theses collars and the only reason why we have to keep buying them is our puppies grow up and they get them dirty! We have washed them and the dogs go swimming with them and they keep their color. Only down fall is the blueberry logo is a sewn on rubber logo that makes it hard to make the collar smaller.

review_title: Blueberry makes an excellent product and the color can remain the same to adulthood
review_body: Great product it's the third caller I've bought from blueberry in the same color the girls like the fact that the color can remain as our puppy grows into adulthood
It keeps my 60 pound pitbull safe in the backseat! Absolutely worth the purchase!!!
Perfect! Love the extra "holder bands"! Makes for a sturdier collar.
I really like this collar, very bright, I got the bright pink one for my black lab....just wish it was a bit thicker, but still love it!

Super cute color - although I'm not sure if every tag thing is so fat. it was hard to attach my dogs little name thing to it but then again ive never done it before so maybe they are all like this?  I would def buy it again!

Bought another one after getting a different, winter-themed collar and it looks great on my boy! Went with a royal blue for a regal boy and the color and fit are perfect. The clasp and leash attachment ring are both pretty thick, which is important when using it to wrangle an 85lb beast like mine. Great buy

review_title: It works great to keep him in the back seat
review_body: Got this when we got a larger dog.  It works great to keep him in the back seat.

review_title: so adorable! We get a lot of smiles when folks ...

review_title: Safety for dog in car or rv
review_body: I use this in our rv and it’s great! The dog can still sit in her bed near us but can’t jump on us when we are driving.
My dog wouldn’t eat these and he’s not picky so they must not taste or smell good

review_title: They're soft so I can easily break them into smaller pieces for training to help ...
review_body: My dog loves these. They're soft so I can easily break them into smaller pieces for training to help the bag last longer.

So happy I found these! I give my pups treats for doing their business outside and these are the ones they sit and get excited for the most. They see the jar they’re and get so happy that they can’t even sit still. Bought more for them as well.

review_title: I love this product and so does my puppy
review_body: I love this product and so does my puppy! This is great for puppies that are teething and cant eat hard foods. I've tried other treats that says soft or  chewy but they were still too hard for my 6 week old Yorkie. This product is great will definitely buy again.

review_title: Wellness is a great brand you can trust
review_body: My little girl loves these treats and she is 14!  Wellness is a great brand you can trust.

review_title: puppy could not handle hem he's 4 months old

review_title: My puppy goes crazy over these!

My goldendoodle puppy (10 weeks) LOVES these!! They are soft, so they’re perfect for her little teeth.

use as re-set treats when I'm training - small heavy enough to throw - doesnt make his poop runny... I use raw meat when training - but this is much easier to throw - and offers him a difference in taste and texture.
Best training treats and my dogs love them!!!! They are very soft and split in 1/2 very easy which is great for small breeds with tiny mouths.

review_title: I liked it a lot and would buy another again if ...

Simple quality product, we bought two collars.

Good collar but with it had a separate place for his vet and name tags rather than the same spot you click the leash to
I had to buy another one!  These are great collars!  My dogs love their colorful necklaces
Love the vibrant color! The sizing chart was correct and it fits our 3 month old Siberian Husky puppy great! I also bought the matching leash.

review_title: Great collar nice color variety good value

The plastic latch is completely stuck closed and will not come apart no matter how hard I try.  I've used it less than 4 months and unless I can somehow get it to come apart, I will have to replace it.

review_title: Easy on and off.  Works fine.

review_title: My dog thinks they are pretty tasty but they lost one star from me because ...

I got these ( like 8 bags) for Petcube dispensing the treat to our dog. It works but maybe not perfect size for the dispenser as it shoots out like 5 at a time. Guess that's more design flaw of Petcube but in the end dog likes it and it works.

I purchased these to be training treats but they're crunchy and take a little dogs longer to chew. So for little dogs they're great treats and for big dogs they're great training treats. Quality ingredients we love wellness. PS they do have softer small bite-size training treats that work great
puppy loves them and they are soft and easy for her to chew with her baby teeth.

review_title: it's soft and you easy to tear if you need to make the pieces ...

review_title: Absolutely moronic to put a big rubber tag on the ...

review_title: I was expecting the Florence Orange color to be like a safety orange

review_title: My puppy wouldn't eat these treats...

review_title: Break the treat into smaller portions
review_body: The puppy loves this treat!  I use this to potty train a 8 weeks old puppy and so far its working great.  Every time the puppy uses the training pads to pee or poop, I praise it afterwards and give it a small piece of the treat.  If your puppy is very young, break the treat and give it a tiny piece, not the whole piece because the tiny puppy needs to adjust to its diet.  When I first gave my puppy the treat, it had diarrhea.  So I stopped giving it and then after a few days, I would give it only a very small part of the treat and it is fine.  The idea is that the puppy gets a reward for potty training, so even if the treat is a tiny piece as long as the puppy can taste it, its good.  When the puppy gets bigger and has better digestive system, you can give it more treats and in whole pieces.  I break one whole piece into 4 or 5 very small pieces.  My chihuahua puppy has adjusted to it and it no longer has soft stool or diarrhea from this treat. It absolutely love this treat and will go crazy happy over this treat.  Also, i find it beneficial to my puppy's digestive system to give it a tiny bit of greek yogurt (the non-fat low sugar kind) and the puppy loves the greek yogurt (i give like half teaspoon, very little).

My bulldog puppy loves these and I love that they are all natural. My bulldogs are my babies and I only like to give them the best quality food and that includes treats. These Just For Puppy Soft natural puppy treats from Wellness are perfect and exactly what I was looking. They are made with wholesome grains, fruits, and vegetables. Even better, they don't contain any wheat, corn, soy or artificial flavors, colors or preservatives which is great for my dogs. Bulldogs are especially prone to food allergies. My adult bulldog has food and skin allergies so these are fine for her to eat as well. My puppy doesn't have any known allergies yet, but I try to avoid any ingredients that could cause a reaction in the first place. Wellness is a brand that I trust and I always feel confident feeding my dogs their products. I highly recommend these dog treats!

Although this dog collar is sturdy, with strong hardware, and reinforced stitching, it has a fault that makes this collar unwearable for my dogs. The logo is on a raised rubber label that doesn't fit through the adjuster buckle. Unfortunately my two dogs (I bought two of these collars) need the adjustment right in the middle of this label. If I try tightening the collar all they way, the collar would be ok, but tighter than I want, and the label still would be stuck in the adjuster buckle. I tried letting them wear the collar larger, but they keep losing them, as they slip over their heads. I'll donate these to the local shelter.

review_title: awesome pet treats for the smallest of puppies
review_body: Okay so my mom was recommended by the breeder,  this "treat" for her new 3 .4 pound,  Bichon Bolognese pup (said with sarcasm but with so much love) as it was a great product. And it is. On a pup this size you can actually get about 9 serving's of treats. Seriously. @ 3 lbs little bits are best. I am figuring with a standard pup of 12-15 lbs you could even do half. The product is very soft and chewy- great for teething, and are scored- so cutting is a cinch. Puppy seems to really love them and in less then 2 weeks of ownership my mom had him learning new commands.

Quality: Puppy LOVES them. I have a Standard Poodle and they are typically picky eaters, but he has no hesitations with these treats. Good quality ingredients and perfect for little baby teeth since they are soft. I was able to easily break them in half too for when my puppy was really little.

So we just got a new puppy.  She is really cute.  And I love giving her snacks.  Because she is just too cute.  I really can not handle it.  My husband scolds me for giving her too many of these things but I can not help it!  The pup loves these things.  It's like crack for her.  She will constantly beg for these treats, and this is the only way we can get her to do any tricks at all.  It is always a mystery what is in dog food, but this product seems like it has good nutrients for my pup.  We used this to effective train her to go potty on a mat inside, and when she got her appropriate shots, for her to go outside.  It is also perfect for puppies because they are nice and soft.  Our puppy had a hard time chewing kibble because her little teeth could not handle the hard kibble.  So it was nice to find a treat that she does not have to work too hard to chew.  She really craves these things.  We also were having a hard time getting her to eat her kibble recently, so we would bury these little treats into her kibble and that helped her eat her kibble for a while.  But...I think that stopped working because she just wants to eat the kibble now.  I guess we should cut back on giving her these treats.

review_title: Puppy's FAVORITE Treat! Great for Training!
review_body: My Shih Zu/Yorkie/Pomeranian mixed puppy LOVES these treats! Perfect for Training use- at first I could cut them up into small squares since we were just starting out with training and he'd literally end up eating the whole bag in a day or two if we gave him a whole treat each time he went outside to pee/poop etc. These are his favorite but he also loves the crunchy ones too! Wellness brand is such a great company for food and treats to keep your fur babies healthy and strong. No complaints with any of their products! The price here on Amazon is about $2 cheaper than Petco and other retailers here in Maine so anytime I make a purchase on Amazon I add a bag or two of these to my order as an add on item.

I like the color assortments that this collar is available in. I love the rich blue color that I ordered. This is a sturdy and adjustable collar and my dog has room to grow with this one yet. He has not broken free from this collar even when trying to chase rabbits. I will order this one in the future if needed.

review_title: My dog's neck is 14. 5" in circumference. ...
review_body: My dog's neck is 14.5" in circumference. I ordered the small size that is specified to fit necks 12"-16" and 5/8" wide. The collar I received is about 1/2" in width and expands, at the largest, to 15" which is too tight on my dog. The smallest this collar gets is 11". The specs on the collar are wrong.

review_title: Blueberry Pet is one of the best brands I have seen in a while
review_body: Blueberry Pet is one of the best brands I have seen in a while. Even though it was a little too big, it adjusted well. Very well made and very cute, I would recommend it to any one. I bought the collar and leash, both matching royal blue and it's been weeks, it still looks good! And I have to say, my dog is pretty messy. So to any one that asks me, I'd say, Blueberry Pet is the best!
Beautiful vibrant red and very durable
My little guy looks so handsome in his new collar! And it's great to find one that actually fits him!
I got the pink color for my female dog and its beautiful! Just as pictured and great quality! Happy with my purchase will be using Blueberry products for future purchases. :) LOVE!

I bought the purple XS Blueberry collar for my 2 month old LAB. I feel like she will only get a little use out of it. The sizing seems to be a bit off & it is super thin material. My husband thought it was a cat collar when it first arrived in the mail. It was also packaged weird, as i had to be very careful not to cut the collar itself because the zip ties were so tight. It gets three stars, i'm hoping it will last longer than i expect. I probably will not purchase again, but who knows.
looks great well made

These are my favorite dog treats for my 12 week old puppy. They are also my cat's favorite dog treats. The cat always tries to sneak by and snag them from the dog, so they must be really tasty. review_title: My picky pup goes crazy for these.

my dog loves it!
great product. great price. These are my puppies favorite. Recieved it very fast. My only complaint was that it was sent in a very large box. It would have done better in a mailer envelope.

review_title: They are perfect. I can easily smoosh them and let my ...
review_body: I purchased these as training rewards.  They are perfect.  I can easily smoosh them and let my pup nibble a little.  She really likes them and they add to her motivation to try new things, even though she likes to please.  I am very happy with these treats.
DOES NOT GET ANY BETTER THAN THIS. Top of the line company, I had no doubts with this purchase

review_title: They are also easy to tear and break down when training
review_body: I give these to my adult dogs in small pieces when training. Because they are soft and moist, they are more fragrant and attractive than the typical dry biscuit dog treat. They are also easy to tear and break down when training.
Good and soft
I just got these treats in the mail and my puppy is CRAZY about them! It made training so much easier. Pieces are also easy to break into smaller ones.

Our puppy goes crazy over these treats.  I think he would do anything for them.  He's so eager to learn knowing he'll get rewarded with something yummy.  I love that these are a healthier treat option for him too.  Try them, bet your little guy or gal will love them!!

I did a ton of research to decide what was the best food and treats to feed my shih tzu puppy, and nothing beat wellness in my opinion or my vets. Not only does my puppy love the food and treats, they are healthy, and I don't feel guilty giving them to her for training. She got into the bag and ate a lot, and didn't get sick, or have any digestion issues. She is growing healthy and big, and I wont feed her anything else.
We used these as training treats for my and my brother's puppies and they loved them. The package is really small though. These sell for around $4 in a store and the 8oz bags are $7.99!

Pricey, but worth it. all natural and my puppy transitioned to this food perfectly. No degestion problems and she loves it!

review_title: My pup doesn't think of it as "high value" treat!
review_body: Got this for my puppy as his breeder feeds him Wellness Core.  I thought I would stay within the same line.  He doesn't really care for it.  Maybe I will try to get a different flavor next time.

Not only are these healthy and great for teething puppies (because of the softness), I've been giving these to my puppy for months and they're his favorite! I give him other treats as well but he seems to get most excited about these ones. Treats that your puppy loves makes it easier to train!
I have six dogs and none of them even touched it, not a single piece

My blue heeler pup likes Wellness Grain Free puppy food but she definitely is not impressed by these treats, nor am I.  They are very expensive, a bit too big for training treats, they have a unappealing smell and apparently don't taste that great as my dog eats them reluctantly.  I definitely will stay with Blue Buffalo Chicken or Turkey training treats... which my dog will do ANYTHING for one of those!

These are the first treats I had purchased for our new puppy after reading several reviews on Amazon.  He'd only been home a few days and we were trying to reward him for going potty outside - these treats were completely counteractive.  The first night after starting the treats, his stools became very runny and he made many messes in the house.  We continued to give him the treats for another three days as we didn't realize the connection - his stools hardened the day after we stopped using these treats and he can now hold it and go outside!  He's been doing MUCH better on other puppy treats (went to PetCo for them) and I'm so thankful the runny poo messes are no longer a threat to my barefoot family.
Big and cannot be broken apart for small dogs
I ordered these for our new pup, she ate them up so fast I had to order 2 more bags! They worked PERFECTLY for potty training! She LOVES them!!! I highly recommend them!

review_title: My dog absolutely loved these and these treats are supposed to be for ...
review_body: My dog absolutely loved these and these treats are supposed to be for training. So he ate 5 or 6 pieces in about 15 minutes. Then got very very sick shortly after with uncontrollable diarrhea. I've had my dog for two months now and not once has he gotten sick from anything he ate. Poor little guy had such a tough night. Also this $3 bag of treats cost me a $40 doormat ruined by puppy diarrhea. Definitely do not recommend these treats

review_title: My puppy loves these training treats!
review_body: My puppy loves these treats!  Although they are small in size, I am still able to break each treat into 4-5 even smaller rewards.  She gets super excited when she sees this bag during training sessions and is always eager to earn her treats.

The treats are GREAT. My puppy will follow any directive if offered this reward. However, you can purchase this same pouch (3.5 oz) at PetSmart for $4.99 full price. I made the mistake of purchasing this same product for around $9 each, assuming it was a larger bag (the size of the adult Wellness treats that cost $11 in the stores -- also very good products, loved by my dogs).  Purchasing at that price was my mistake. Just remember when purchasing this product that one 3.5 oz. bag of Puppy Wellness treats costs $4.99 in any pet store.

review_title: Stains my clothes! The pods don't dissolve all the ...

review_title: Puppy LOVES them! Doesn't upset his tummy!
review_body: Puppy is addicted! We quarter them and give him 1 quarter as a reward when he goes potty! He LOVES them and no issues. This is the 3rd pup we have used them with!

review_title: A healthy treat my pup won't eat
review_body: Our rescue puppy repeatedly suffers from allergies, especially food allergies as well as the occasional bout with upset stomach. He can also be a bit of a picky eater when it comes to his treats so finding the right mix can often be difficult. I always have reservations about trying new dog snacks as a large majority of popular brands are filled with terrible ingredients not to mention carrying a high price tag. I'm always willing to try a new brand so here are my thoughts on Wellness Puppy Bites Natural Grain Free Puppy Training Treats;

These have to be by far my puppies favorite treats!  We got a little pug puppy for my daughter this Christmas and I had purchased a few different types of treats for him. I bought these for the brand name because I had heard it was a good food company. Well I thought for sure he would like hard chew bones, nope. A few others nope but not these. He looooves these little treats and they are really soft and he has no trouble chewing them. it may be that he is a small breed and so they are easier for him with being soft. I can also say that my daughter loves the smell of them and has to smell them every time she gives one to the puppy haha. I was so glad I had gotten these and he loves them so much that I have already bought a second bag!

review_title: Soft bites are truly soft and a hit at my house
review_body: This review is for the Soft Lamb and Salmon variety.  At the current price of $3.60 for a 3-ounce bag, I think it's a pretty good product.

My puppy absolutely LOVES these. I began giving them to him for using the pee pads when he was just shy of 11 weeks. He gets beyond excited when I mix these with TONS of praise. He runs right over to where I keep them, knowing he will be rewarded. I barely break off enough to seem to matter, but honestly his reaction is priceless. I use them when we do our collar and leash drills, too. Again, very, very small amount. I am conscious of the ingredients. In many of the products, there is added sugar or sweetener or they are not appropriate for under a certain weight and age. I cannot say if my puppy will grow tired of them, he is only 12 weeks old, but for now I would tell you to give them a try.

Yep, these things are dinky.  They come in a three delightful little shapes—heart, tennis ball, and dog house—but the average size is that of a peanut M&M.  So, you get lots of them in this six-ounce bag.

review_title: Great flavor our dog absolutely loved!
review_body: We have switched our dogs over to no grain products in the food and treats because of a recommendation from our vet. When I saw that these were grain free I thought we would give them a try.
My aunt and I take care of 9 dogs (strays and rescued from the pound) at her hilltop property.

review_title: Crunchy but are not too hard and they make our little dog happy
review_body: These are a great size for our smallest dog.  In age she might be past puppy-hood, but in looks, she's very small and petite.  I usually have to break up treats for her, but these treats are small and fit her little mouth perfectly.

review_title: Nice Texture and Ingredients for Pups
review_body: With these soft bites I like both the texture and the ingredients for my dogs. The main ingredients are real meats; lamb and salmon, then there's tons of veggies. It has lots of anti-oxidants too. They don't know any different because the texture seems like a jerky almost. It's a step between "dog food" and meat that piques most pups' interests. The shape is very flat and small. They're good for pretty much all sized puppies once they're chewing and eating solids.

review_title: Good quality, Made in the USA with globally sourced ingredients
review_body: These little treats are soft and easy to chew, so they are well suited for puppies or for seniors. I like that the ingredient list is simple, and I appreciate that chicken didn't show up on the lamb and salmon variety. Chicken is an allergen for many dogs, yet often appears lower down on the ingredient list for seafood or other meat pet foods.

I use these treats to train our 2-month-old German Shepherd puppy. I should mention that I've never bought dog treats before so I don't have a basis for comparison. I tear these into halves or quarters with my hands since he is still small and I don't want to overfeed him. He is motivated by them in low-distraction environments but not in high-distraction ones (where real meat is more effective). He has some trouble chewing them (sometimes they fall out of his mouth and he has trouble finding them), so I kind of wish I had bought the crunchy ones, but it is nice to be able to break them into smaller pieces easily. He also just seems to prefer hard/crunchy things in general.

review_title: Soft and easy to quarter but not as interested after trying other treats
review_body: I started using these treats for training our maltipoo, Charlie, starting at 8 weeks old. The treats are soft and break apart into quarters quite easily. This was essential since he is still only 10 lbs now as an adult. However, when he had a taste of other meatier, and I suppose tastier, treats, he was not so much a fan of these treats anymore. Definitely use them when your pup is young and new to treats or if you do not plan on introducing any other treats for the time being. I did appreciate that the treats do not crumble as they are very moist and were easy to use in training sessions. My dog currently goes nuts for anything stinky and/or meaty -- fish skins, lamb lung, liver treats, wet dog food, deli meats, etc. -- definitely considers those to be high value treats. These soft puppy bites would be adequate as low value treats for a young puppy not yet exposed to higher value treats. Good luck!

review_title: Pup LOVES them and we are happy with the ingredients for the most part!  Not sure about soy...?
review_body: We are watching a friend's labradoodle puppy while they are dealing with a family emergency.  The cute little guy has an issue with grains, much like our Senior English Mastiff male does, so we were excited to find these grain free treats for him.  The treats are perfectly sized for him for use when training, he wolfs them down like he can't get enough and they are fairly healthy to boot!  The ingredients are all well thought out and they manage to avoid common allergens like wheat, corn and dairy and specifically avoid meat by products, which is great!  They do contain tocopheryls which CAN include soy...I do wonder since it doesn't explicitly say they do not contain soy.  (Our friends feel like we do about soy and avoid it for our fur babies!) .

review_title: Not sure, but puppy got sick using these as training treats!
review_body: I have gone through many packages of these treats and the dog did not have a problem.  I was using them just as treats though.  Yesterday, I used them as training treats which means I had to give my puppy quite a few of them.  Things went well.  Last night, however, turned horrlble - vomiting and diarrhea.  I can't be sure if these treats are the culprit, but they were the only things eaten at 7 p.m. last night the disaster started to happen around 10 or 11 p.m.
Came to purchase these for my puppy and read that garlic powder was an ingredient. “

review_title: Sized well for using with dog treat toy puzzles
review_body: Puppy Bites are a great size treat for little dogs since they're much smaller then the typical dog treat. However I've found they work great for large dogs too, when using them with puzzle toys.

review_title: Would not recommend, caused loose stools
review_body: Tried these on a whim from a pet store as we were getting low on the Wellness Core Pure Rewards Jerky Bites which we've used for some time.  I was thinking to repurchase this Wellness Soft Puppy Bites product from Amazon if our pup liked them.  Well, pup did seem to really enjoy them (note I only gave 2 pieces in total, broken into smaller pieces for training purposes).  Right away the next day as others have mentioned, our pup developed very loose stools and quite a lot of foul-smelling gas.  Our pup has had no digestion problems ever before and we did not change any other diet variables.  I am promptly returning this particular product to the store and do NOT recommend!

review_title: High Quality Soft & Hard Dog Treats
review_body: Of all the soft puppy bites I have tried, these are comparable to the best.  They are small, perfect for training / rewarding your dog.  And they stay fresh in the resealable pouch.
These chicken and carrot treats smell good and they certainly must taste good because they get two paws up from the puppy and the older dog likes them, too.

review_title: I LOVE the ingredients in them (which is why I purchased ...
review_body: My aussie pup loves these bites, however they are a little bigger than I was hoping. I LOVE the ingredients in them (which is why I purchased them in the first place), and they smell delicious, for the pup of course. However I am currently in the training stage with my pup and I like to use small treats so I can give him a lot of them as we are training. I typically rip these in half, or into 3rds so that my he gets more out of them. I also with the bag was a little bigger for the price. Other than that they are great.

review_title: or good behavior when not feasting on this amazing treat
review_body: I bought this on a whim to try to train my defiant puppy.  Little did I know that this would turn out to be crack to my 5 pound pup.  She absolutely loves this treat and will listen to my every command when these are in hand.  Now, she doesn't care for rules, compliance, or good behavior when not feasting on this amazing treat.  But that's more a problem with her general personality and my poor puppy parenting.  I've been feeding these to her since she was 3 months old, and she's still hopelessly addicted.  Good for puppies because they're small and soft.
I've been using Wellness "Just for Puppy" dry dog food mix ever since I brought my French Bulldog puppy home with great results. My pup simply loves his dog food and happily chows down at every meal.

review_title: Good ingredients, loved by our dogs
review_body: We have three small dogs and when I am holding this package of treats, I do not know how, but they are around my feet every time. They really seem to enjoy them.

My puppy is...big. But, we still like to give him small bites of something as training treats, and these fit the bill perfectly. Though I'm not sure he actually chews them sometimes...Anyway, he loves them, and would happily snarf the entire bag if given the option. If you have a small dog - not necessarily a puppy, but a smaller breed, these would also be great just in general for treats. They're a good size for that. So far, we've been quite pleased with the Wellness treats, and these are no different.

So I had bought a 2 pack of these same treats from pet co while I bought their cage back when they were a month or two. I totally forgot I stashed the other bag of these in my cabinet.. Soo cute. I forgot how much they had loved these back then! They beg and start doing tricks for me when I ask if they want a treat. or if I open the door to the cabinet. lol

It is indeed soft, great for puppies. My picky 6 yr old chiwawa likes it as well. I have to give him one whenever I give puppy one  and he sees it, as its only fair. It doesnt provide him much nutritional value but its ok. They both will gladly sit/listen for these treats. Theres nothing super weird or sketchy in the ingredients list either. I break it in half for my puppy to make the bag last a wee bit longer.

My dog is a little over 1 now and is not too crazy about hard treats, so i have been looking for soft ones, stumbled upon these and she absolutely loves these! Whenever I grab the bag she starts doing circles in excitement.

review_title: Crunchy training treats for the most dogged chewer
review_body: Nice little treats that are amazing training aids. Not too many calories, but with the right amount of crunch to satisfy the little needle teeth of the most dogged puppy. Wellness makes the best high quality food and treats (although it can get pricey, really quick.) This is a great way to get the puppy off on a solid foundation. My only hesitation with these treats is that they are on the high side, pricewise. If you can catch them on sale, grab them!

review_title: but stool smells really terrible whenver I feed this more than two pieces
review_body: I have a pomapoo puppy and she seems to be enjoying this treat, but stool smells really terrible whenver I feed this more than two pieces. I do not recommand to give too much this treat for causing watery output as well. I give her two pieces which is cut into three parts every other day to avoid watery stool or just as a reward doing her poo outside.

review_title: This is the first treat my dog has stayed interested in past a few days
review_body: I waited a bit to review this, because my yorkie tends to like treats for a few days, and then lose interest.  We have been using these intermittently for about a month now, and just today, he still sat happily for two of them (and didn't then drop and ignore them as he has done with many in the past).  I'm greatly encouraged and may actually try and do some training with these, and try some other flavors.  Definitely recommend

We use these for potty treats for our 9 week old pug. The treats are about the size of a nickle and square so we break them in half for potty time. Half for pee, half for poop. She loves these treats and always comes running up for one after pottying. They are very soft and she has no problem eating them quickly.

My 12 week old pomeranian loves these, it helped me a lot while training him on the pee pad.  I like the soft one because you can break the squares into 1/4 pieces, when we are training to play fetch and reward him for good behavior

Adopting a Miniature Schnauzer after the loss of my Standard Schnauzer last month, I felt the pressure of having to house break a puppy once again. The previous owner allowed him to remain in his crate too long each day, so I geared up for the battle. I used chicken strips to train the Standard; however, my Miniature nearly jumped out of the shopping cart when a Petco dog trainer gave him a sample of this treat. It took me nearly three months to house break my Standard compared to less than two weeks for my Miniature. He receives this treat when he urinates outside and another (expensive) treat for his poop in order to understand the difference between the two in addition to preventing him from "eating the same ol' cracker for both actions". I have never witnessed a dog go wild over a treat until now, and I am willing to invest in such product as long as we both experience an award in the end.

These are great for leash training! I can stick a handful in my pocket and split them into two or four pieces to keep the number of treats low but still reward my puppy for her successes! And she loves them!

review_title: Not her favorite, but otherwise fine
review_body: Good ingredients, great size pieces, I like that they aren't crumbly and don't leave crumbs in my pocket and aren't greasy. That said, they aren't my dog's favorite. If she's tired she won't roll over for one of these, but she will for other treats. I use them for low reward activities - like clipping her nails.

review_title: Avoid these treats!  Possible cause of death!!
review_body: Our 7 week old puppy passed away after eating these treats.  Of course we can’t prove it was the treats that caused her death but the puppy had just been to the vet and had a clean bill of health so we will not be using these treats again just to be sure!
My pug is technically not a puppy anymore, but he loves these and I can reward him without making him fat because they're small! Also easy for him to eat. He has trouble with bigger or harder treats.
I don't want to be mean, but this is how their ad reads verbatim " Each puppy treat is made with wholesome grains, fruits and veggies you can see--

My Havanese would literally spit out any other treat he was given.  Finally, at his first trip to the groomer, the store owner offered to open several varieties of treats to see if he would accept any of them.  We struck gold with these.  He devoured the treat he was offered and has come to recognize the Wellness bag.

These are great dog treats. Although not using on a puppy they are small and I see where the puppy targeting comes in.  My two little dogs love these treats- I only feed one or two a day and no adverse side effects like runny droppings.  Love the Wellness brand and confident with the ingredients. My dogs do flips over these treats!

The dogs truly loved these.  They are perfect training sized snacks, or as we used them as treats to bait dog intellect games.  We have always been comfortable with the quality of the Wellness brand treats and felt good about feeding these to the dogs.

Wellness Puppy Bites Natural Grain Free Puppy Training Treats are great little treats/rewards for your pup.  They are well received  and the dogs certainly appear to like them.  They are smaller and better suited for pups.  Being grain free is a great benefit.  They are small enough to be used for rewards and not fill the dogs up.

review_title: Read the 1 & 2 star reviews & love your dogs people.
review_body: Bites are not soft. Also Upset my 13 lb Teddybear 15 mo.old. I have. 2&1/2 unused pkgs for the trash. The people who have more than 1 star ratings must have dogs with cast iron stomachs. No more Wellness brand products for me.

review_title: They love them. We feed the same brand of food ...
review_body: We use these treats for our two puppies.  They love them.  We feed the same brand of food to our puppies, and the ingredients are very similar.  This prevents intestinal problems that some puppies have with giving different treats with different ingredients.

His poop smelled a bit the first time I introduced these treats, but afterwards everything returned back to normal. review_title: We have tried all the flavors of these treats,
review_body: We have tried all the flavors of these treats, and it appears that this one wins the flavor test in this household

review_title: Like a lot of other reviews have said
review_body: My cocker spaniel puppy (8 weeks) really likes these treats. I break them in half so they are easier for her to chew up. Like a lot of other reviews have said, they did give my puppy really soft poop. I don't think that is necessarily the treats fault though. Although I can't confirm that 100%. Puppies already have very sensitive stomachs and introducing something like this into their diet is probably going to have to be in moderation. I was using these as rewards for going potty outside and they definitely worked. But for now I'm going to switch regular chicken breast in hopes that it won't be so hard on her stomach.
These are fine except for the cost. My dog loved the taste, the small snack size makes sense for puppies, but $10 for this tiny bag? I can't say I would ever buy these myself.

review_title: I love the ingredients and they smell like they would be ...
review_body: I have a bulldog puppy who refuses to eat these. I love the ingredients and they smell like they would be good but he won't touch them. I gave it two stars because I'm sure they're fine just not what he likes.

The strong smell is attractive to my puppy, but these treats are much bigger than I had expected. I was expecting something a little smaller for puppy training purposes. I break these into 1/4s for potty training.

I got these as a gift and wanted to use them for puppy training. It immediately made my puppy violently ill - I stayed up all night watching helplessly as my pup vomited more than 8 times + diarrhea. Took two expensive vet visits to make sure he was ok + a ton of crying. Why would you even put garlic in these treats?! Never again.

I just found an odd black piece inside the bag. It was not feature on the front of the bag, so I can assume it does not belong inside. Hopefully it is harmful to my dog because he had a few pieces before I saw the black piece.

I've always been confident when choosing a Wellness product for my dogs, and these puppy treats are another quality product. They're soft, and apparently taste great. The ingredients are all healthy, with no byproducts, fillers, or chemical preservatives.
I swear by these!! I have had my puppy for about a month now and she goes crazy (and trains) for these treats! I'm on bag...4/5!

The puppy loved these tiny treats. So glad to see so many new choices for grain free treats to go along with the grain free foods. Maybe TMI, but it helps keeps the stools from being so yucky and smelly and also keeps away skin issues in our case.

review_title: Puppy loved them but they caused some soft stools
review_body: I got these for my mini schnauzer when he was really young to use as a training aid. He absolutely loved them and would do anything for one. Unfortunately, they caused him to have some pretty soft stools. It only happened when he ate more than a few (normally on puppy kindergarten nights) but it was clear that they weren't really agreeing with his stomach. It's unfortunate because he really loved them. I've since switched to Little Jacs which seems to be working out better overall. To be fair, my dog tends to have a pretty sensitive stomach overall so these may work out better for a less finicky pup!

After going back and forth between pet stores exchanging bags of treats over and over again, i finally found that my 14 week old shih tzu Bailey loves these. He also loves the Wellness Just for Puppy canned food as well - gobbles it up. He is one of those pups that is super particular about his food. With other brands of food, he wont eat just dry - it must be mixed with wet AND must be heated to a certain temperature. With Wellness, he gobbles it all up mixed with his dry food, no matter what the temp.
My dogs loved them. They are soft so I  break them in half and use as a training treat.

We switched to this food after our puppy started having tummy issues. He was on Life's Abundance, which was recommended by the breeder, but the puppy seems to do better on this food. Since being on this food he begs for food less often, he eats less random stuff on the ground and his coat is thicker and softer. I believe the tummy issues are related to teething and not to the food.

review_title: GARLIC POWDER IS TOXIC TO DOGS AND CATS
review_body: DO NOT BUY THESE -- or any other dog treat with GARLIC POWDER as an ingredient.  Garlic powder is TOXIC to both dogs and cats and can cause anemia and upset stomach, just like onions.  I can't believe a holistic dog food treat is making this fatal mistake.  I hope everyone reads this!! Please pass this info on!  I see too many people giving their dogs chicken broth and tomato sauce with garlic and onion in it -- TOXIC.
